Analyst, Commercial Analytics & Pricing

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $42 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving sophisticated analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or growing efficiency in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our distributed team of more than 120,000 colleagues delivers an outstanding combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. Thermo Fisher Scientific is an equal opportunity employer. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.


The Analyst, Commercial Analytics & Pricing role plays a pivotal role within the Analytical Instrument Group (AIG), focusing on improving commercial analytics and pricing capabilities for AIG. The role's responsibilities encompass the development of sophisticated analytics, tools, and dashboards crafted to furnish informative business intelligence, facilitating informed decision-making processes for the AIG commercial teams. The ideal candidate will provide a blend of robust technical competence and hands-on experience with large data sets, complemented by excellent communication and teamwork aptitudes, enabling effective interactions with diverse teams. This role presents an outstanding opportunity for aspirational talents to deepen their grasp of data science, business intelligence, and the intricacies of commercial management in a highly transparent setting.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Division Commercial and Finance teams to develop data analytics, models, and dashboards to derive insights, monitor commercial performances, and assess funnel health.
Leverage data analytics/science tools (e.g., gene.ai) to empower commercial teams in identifying new leads, cross-selling opportunities, and market trend shifts.
Translate business challenges and opportunities into quantitative analyses to uncover actionable patterns and insights.
Provide expertise in price setting, discount adjustments, and promotion design, ensuring thoughtful tradeoffs between price and volume to drive share gain and volume uptick.
Deliver regular pricing reports and implement tools to guide business partners in making informed decisions, while analyzing market trends, opportunities, and risks.
Lead business reviews emphasizing pricing insights and strategies, ensuring efficient market positioning and potential improvements.
Ensure data quality and readiness, handling tasks like data clean-up, integration, transformation, and validation.
Collaborate with business partners and D&T teams to establish robust data pipelines catering to diverse analytics needs, and further a data-driven decision-making culture.
Craft use cases, develop mock-ups, and refine tools based on iterative business feedback. Lead all aspects of user acceptance testing (UAT), tool demos, and training sessions.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

BS or MS Degree in finance, business, math, statistics, computer science, data science or related
Minimum 1-3 years of work experience in data analytics, business intelligence, finance, commercial analytics, or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and experience of building data models
Proficiency in Excel; prior experience in SQL, Python, or Power BI is strongly preferred.
Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate complex data models and business problems
Ability to work across a matrix org structure and influence business partners
Self-motivated, able to drive actions to completion with intensity and ownership
Passionate about learning business and data
Ability to travel (10%)

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 120,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve sophisticated scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

As a Configuration Data Analyst I, you will:
Create and manage data structure and configuration of data, from top level catalog materials to Bill of Materials and routing data, to even purchasing and procurement data for lower level materials. Assist with various exception reports or processes to identify and resolve issues with in process orders. Develops and uses diverse and thorough understanding of integrated computer systems to configure data and implement processes for ordering and manufacturing systems.

Develops and implements testing strategies to confirm configuration of product models to match both product intent and marketing documentation.
Creates Change Orders to document, communicate, and drive proper workload of data changes throughout organization and, ultimately, applicable data management systems, to support New Product Introduction (NPI) and Maintenance of Business (MOB), through product, BOM, and process routings introductions and changes.
Troubleshoots system, process, or data issues, and uses root cause analysis to recommend changes in data, processes, or systems to avoid similar issues in future.
Applies system, process, and product knowledge while working with team members to implement data changes in controlled manner, using change order systems and cooperative team practices.
Resolves more complex data entry and process issues when problems are identified. Facilitates reduction or elimination of Remedy Force tickets regarding order entry and order processing issues through use of root cause analysis to drive reduction in common causes of errors and improve customer-facing performance.
Coordinates development of metrics to measure various facets of customer satisfaction.
Leads data management within corporate finish database to assist with data accuracy and consistency.
Performs continuous improvement and other mass-data cleansing activities. Identifies opportunities for standardization of process to eliminate errors and inconsistencies.
Can perform functions of lower-level positions; mentors and provides training to lower-level position members.
Serves as product systems expert for department and supporting departments to assist with understanding of processes, data extraction, and data management.

OR

Job Title: Biomechanics Associate – Data and Computational Modeling (Ph.D.)
Job Description:
About Exponent:
Exponent is the only premium engineering and scientific consulting firm with the depth and breadth of expertise to solve our clients’ most profoundly unique, unprecedented, and urgent challenges.

We are committed to engaging multidisciplinary teams of science, engineering, and regulatory experts to empower our clients with solutions that create a safer, healthier, more sustainable world. For over five decades, we've connected the lessons of past failures with tomorrow's solutions to advise clients as they innovate technologically complex products and processes, ensure the safety and health of their users, and address the challenges of sustainability.

Join our team of experts with degrees from top programs at over 500 universities and extensive experience spanning a variety of industries. At Exponent, you’ll contribute to the diverse pool of ideas, talents, backgrounds, and experiences that drives our collaborative teamwork and breakthrough insights. Plus, we help you grow your career through mentoring, sponsorship, and a culture of learning. Thanks for your interest in joining our team!

Key statistics:
950+ Consultants
640+ Ph.D.s
90+ Disciplines
30+ Offices globally
Our Opportunity:

We are currently seeking a Biomechanics Associate – Data and Computational Modeling for our Biomechanics Practice in Farmington Hills, MI. In this role, you will work as part of a team supporting our rapidly advancing proactive, real-world, data-driven insights initiative informing product design and innovation, utilization of digital health technologies and supporting data analytics capabilities to monitor and predict a broad range of patient outcomes.

You will be responsible for:
Designing and executing human experiments to quantify and interpret explicit health, wellness, and performance characteristics within naturalistic movement environments
Deriving, analyzing, and interpreting a variety of complex technology-driven data streams related to human health, wellness, and performance, and human-product interactions in a variety of naturalistic use settings
Using innovative data analysis approaches to understand or inform health, wellness, and performance outcomes for a broad range of biomechanical and physiological data streams.
Writing proposals to initiate and/or support new opportunities in the human performance technology sector (e.g. clinical, military, consumer products, sports)
Researching and reviewing relevant scientific journals, publications, and testing and then analyzing and synthesizing technical biomechanics issues involving kinematics, dynamics, mechanisms of injury, and human tolerance
Clearly communicating findings via written reports and presentations
Demonstrating the ability to synthesize technical information into an easily understood format suitable for presenting to technical and non-technical audiences
You will be working in a small team environment within the larger company-wide Biomechanics Practice, and as such, you will be expected to actively create and pursue opportunities to develop a positive workflow
While balancing the demands of project work, you will be expected to participate in original research, publish papers in technical journals, and present findings at conferences
You will have the following skills and qualifications:
Ph.D. in Biomechanics, Bioengineering, Biomedical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Kinesiology, Movement Science, Physical Therapy, or a related field
Demonstrated experience in study design and associated statistical analyses
Experience in using wearable technologies to quantify human motion/performance in various settings
Significant experience in computational programming (i.e., Python, MATLAB), with an emphasis on signal processing
Prior experience and expertise in working with large-scale datasets is desirable
Effective leadership skills and the ability to interact with a wide variety of professionals, including engineers, scientists, managers, attorneys, and administrative staff
Life @ Exponent:

https://www.exponent.com/careers/life-exponent
https://www.exponent.com/company/our-impact

Position Title
Lead IT Business Analyst

Location
Headquarters-Troy, MI

Job Summary
As the vital link between Flagstar’s Information Technology capabilities and its business objectives and requirements, the Business Analyst role leads technical efforts that translates business needs into new systems and maintains them through their lifecycle through continuous improvement. The Business Analyst’s chief role is partnering with various business divisions implement technological solutions in a cost effective way. The Business Analyst (BA) determines the requirements of a project, enhancement request, or support/maintenance item, communicates the requirements clearly to all stakeholders, technical teams and business partners, and ensures the quality of their implementation. The Lead Business Analyst role is fully committed to using System Development Methodologies to drive the definition, analysis, and documentation of requirements, developing test plans and cases to ensure initial quality and seeing that the business solution is implemented as planned and on time. The Lead Business Analyst acts as the most technical resource to other BAs, works at the highest level of complexity and scope, is accountable for leading teams of technologists, and mentors other, less experienced professionals.

Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for driving the assessment of the business case, the planning and scoping of effort and resources needed, and for eliciting detailed requirements for ongoing maintenance and enhancement of mission critical internal and customer-facing applications. Acts as the conduit between technologists and business customers, responsible for reporting work status updates, providing honest and true representations of effort and progress, facilitating meetings, identifying and notifying business issues and pain points so that decisions can be made on comprehensive technical solutions suggested.
Translating and simplifying requirements then recording and managing the communication of those requirements.
Designs, plans and tests items for the monthly release cycle ensuring all deliverables fulfill requirements and are appropriately documented. Works closely in cross functional technical teams comprised of business analysts, developers, DBAs, architects, etc. as the driver of project progress.
Delegates tasks to project team members with clear deliverables and expected time frames. Follows up on progress of delegated tasks and maintains accountability for all items. Acts as a coach, mentor and trainer for all team members.
Acts as gatekeeper for group application support tickets through assessment of their underlying requirements, assignment to appropriate technical team members, and assurance of resolution. Executes on application release night testing and certification duties, ensuring successful software builds. Ensures the successful execution of business-critical batch processes and manage production incidents to closure.
Staff member is expected to consistently adhere to regulatory and compliance policies and standards linked to their job as listed. Staff member will not repeatedly act in a manner signifying intentional or willful noncompliance, nor exhibit gross negligence or a general disregard for compliance and regulatory standards. Staff member must ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Staff member must complete all required compliance training on a timely basis. Staff member will maintain knowledge of and adhere to Flagstar’s internal compliance policies and procedures. Staff member must take responsibility to keep up to date with changing regulations and policies.
Job Requirements:
High School Diploma, GED, or foreign equivalent required.
Bachelor’s degree plus 10 years work experience preferred or 14 years comparable work experience required.
10 years of experience working directly with technology or interfacing with technology with 7 years leading mid to large sized projects.
1-2 years coaching, mentoring of other professionals.
In depth understanding of relational databases and proficiency in writing queries (SQL and PL SQL).
In depth experience with incident management, leading both on and off-hours ad hoc support teams.
In depth experience with various software development methodologies such as Agile, SCRUM, Waterfall, etc.
Strong experience building, writing and executing test cases (using technologies such Selenium or Loadrunner, is a plus).
Excellent communicator - Ability to communicate verbally and in technical writing to all levels of the organization in a proactive, contextually appropriate manner.
Exceptional strength in interpreting customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirements.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize work by dividing time, attention and effort between assigned workload and on-going support tasks.
Proven ability to adapt and lead through changes in process, procedures and priorities.
Exceptional understanding of business process.
Strong ability to think through workflows and the characteristics that make each workflow different.
Proven ability to establish a high level of trust and confidence in both the business and IT communities.
Strong financial analysis skills and familiarity with financial reporting tools.
Proven ability to deliver presentations of complex information to a variety of audiences.
Proven ability to manage to a project budget.

The Lansing Board of Water & Light has an opening for a Temporary Analyst, Supply Chain, located in Lansing, MI.

Perform various analytical and operational tasks required by the Supply chain department. Duties include analysis of material movements, key performance indicator tracking and reporting, creating, and maintaining operational procedures and supporting procurement and warehousing functions.
Essential Functions:
Gather data and create charts for departmental Key Performance Indicators.
Utilize key performance indicators to develop recommendations for optimizing business performance.
Monitor, track and report out market indicators such as lead times, costs, and supply shortages.
Create, update, and maintain departmental operating procedures with the input of departmental staff.
Utilize these procedures as a basis for process improvement recommendations based on trends identified through KPI tracking. Develops accompanying workflow charts for processes in alignment with ISO 55001 initiatives.
Analyze monthly inventory adjustments and make recommendations for improving material management.
Manage departments project timelines, action items and deliverables.
Maintain vendor scorecard make recommendations for improving the vendor management process.
Analyze new stock requests, fluctuations in re-orders and changes in usage to assist with stocking level decision making.
Develop and maintain a contract expiration date tracking and quarterly reporting process.
Prepare department for quarterly and annual budget to actual review meetings.
At times may support purchasing functions by processing PO acknowledgements, maintaining vendor insurance documents, tracking, and reporting COI expirations, assisting with RFP process functions, and overseeing PO delivery performance tracking and reporting.
Expected to comply with all BWL policies and work rules.
Predictable and reliable attendance.
Other duties as required by Manager.
Job Specifications:
Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Purchasing, Supply Chain or Business Administration, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
A minimum of five years of professional experience in purchasing, warehousing, supply chain management or related field.
Knowledge of SAP; ability to analyze data, identify trends, report key performance indicators and display data in spreadsheets, graphs, charts, and dashboards; understanding of supply chain management.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; excellent oral and written communication skills.
Highly skilled in developing charts, presentations, data analysis, and v-lookup table.
Preferred:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management; experience with warehousing, inventory management and public purchasing.

Physical Requirements / Working Conditions:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must be able to remain in a stationary position for the majority of the working day. The person in this position needs to move about inside the office environment. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. Must communicate frequently with other departments and employees both verbally and in writing. May need to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/ below the knee level, or reach above head. On occasion, may need to use stairs.

Constantly works in a temperature-controlled office environment.

Must successfully complete a background check, a substance screening and a physical (if applicable).

About BWL:
The Board of Water & Light serves Lansing, Michigan, and surrounding areas with electricity, water, and steam. Lansing's city charter vests the BWL with full and exclusive management of water, steam, and electric services for or the city. The American Public Power Association has honored the Lansing Board of Water & Light as one of the country's best publicly owned utilities.

The Location:
Lansing, MI provides the opportunity to enjoy all seasons of fun and beauty. With the Grand River open for kayaking, lush golf courses, 17+ miles of trails for biking/hiking/running, Potter Park Zoo, and the sports, the arts and fine foods that comes from being near a major University, Michigan State University, there is a spot for everyone. The area is a short drive from Lake Michigan’s shoreline where there is views of natural beauty, boating, fishing, and windsurfing.

Job Title: Sr. Workday Analyst, Reporting and Analytics (REMOTE)
Job Description:
Why join Stryker?
We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com


Who we want:

Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and are driven to complete projects that meet regulations and expectations.

Strategic thinkers. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities.

Meticulous documenters. Detail-oriented people who enjoy maintaining meticulous documentation of reports, metrics, proposals, and presentations.

What will you do:


As our Sr. Workday Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the effectiveness of our HR strategies and decision-making processes. You will be primarily responsible for delivering a comprehensive suite of HR reports and dashboards that empower data-driven decision-making. You will engage closely with HR Leaders and Stakeholders to elicit reporting requirements and translate them into actionable data solutions. You will be responsible for analyzing HR Data to uncover valuable insights, including trends, patterns, and anomalies. Additionally, you will provide both predictive and prescriptive analytics to inform strategic decisions. He/She will also be responsible for working in close partnership with functional teams to gain an in-depth understanding of HR processes, ensuring that reporting aligns with operational objectives.


Use Workday, to design and build advance, matrix, and composite reports, including dashboards and prism, to meet customer needs.

Design and build complex calculated fields.

Ensures understanding of requests received by consulting and collaborating with HR and business-facing stakeholders in all data and reporting requests.

Troubleshoot report-related issues and resolve them promptly while providing sustainable solutions that support HR’s vision and mission.

Educate our customers on self-service reporting solutions.

Provides basic reporting training and guidance to customers.

Proactively seek and provide recommendations to improve the efficiency of reports.

Participates and leads projects related to new dashboards and analytics for HR and business leaders.

Meets deadlines and handles varying workloads with a high degree of accuracy, while ensuring compliance with security standards.

Continues to expand Workday reporting expertise.

Supports requests for audits and HR practices requests, ensuring timeliness and data integrity.

Exercises confidentiality, professionalism, and independent judgment in handling confidential information and adhering to governance standards.

Create presentation materials from reporting to support analysis and insights.

Actively support the proper use, storage, and transmission of sensitive employee data and actively participate in system and data quality compliance.

Have a solid understanding of the system’s security and support reporting functionality respectively.

Research data issues and answer questions relating to HR systems’ data.

Communicate regularly with system users on projects, design changes, and other work impacting the user community.

Execute regression and patch testing on HR applications functionality and new system releases and maintain testing plan as needed to support reporting applications.


What you need:

Bachelor’s Degree or in lieu of a degree, an additional 6 years of work experience will be considered.

Minimum 2 years of Workday report/dashboard design and development experience is required.

Experience in translating complex information in an easy, visually effective format that is audience-appropriate.

Ability to work independently as well as a team player in a highly collaborative environment.

Proactive, organized, and quality driven.

Experience with HR Analytics, Data visualization, and workday reporting tools is preferred.

Ability to thrive in fast-paced environments, be able to manage and work to bring clarity through ambiguity and complexity and support multiple projects simultaneously.

Experience working in a regulated environment is preferred.

Workday Certification(s) preferred specifically Workday Reporting

$65,400 - $125,000 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

At Incite, we solve complex business challenges and rapidly realize business value with perceptive problem solving and insightful analytics that drive long-term positive change. Our bold mission is to bridge the gap between data and people.





We do this by focusing on business objectives - the Who, What, Why. We build amazing solutions to meet these needs, and we make sure our clients can use what we build - to get their business questions answered.





We are a senior team of carefully curated, highly professional, and experienced practitioners with diverse skillsets who excel at solving complex business challenges with data-driven solutions. We want our clients to be moved by analytics that we together, create and drive.





We work with name-brand, Fortune 500 clients to drive innovation and transformation within connected mobility, advanced manufacturing and IoT, autonomous vehicles, healthcare, and entertainment industries. We love what we do and believe that work can be done in remote places and with flexible hours, and so we engage team members at various capacities (part-time/full-time) for project work to fit their schedules.


We are seeking a Business Analyst (BA) to support our client engagements, supporting various clients in Metro Detroit and elsewhere.


Our Business Analyst has the exciting job of getting everyone else excited! This includes our clients and internal teams. Our BA has engaging conversations with our clients to uncover (sometimes akin to archeology!) the Who, What, Why - the users and the user goals - of every solution. Our team members are highly skilled, with a diverse set of skillset who seek to solve business problems. He or she will seek to understand the industry, the function, the business, the organization, and business process, and develop an understanding of how the data supports the business objectives.


The successful candidate must be a highly personable individual with a boardroom presence, the desire to gently yet firmly keep a focus on the business objectives, and be able to ask thought-provoking questions to reveal the Who, What, Why. The candidate must be able to build trust and relationships, and lead and guide our clients to see the value in business-focused solutions.


Position Description

In an iterative and agile environment, the Business Analyst will lead clients in user goal oriented requirements definition and translation of those requirements into prioritized users and user goals (the Who, What, Why) - through thoughtful, planned, and engaging discussions following the Incite approach, with the following responsibilities:

working closely with the Analytics UI/UX Designer and the client to collaboratively design high-end wireframes to meet user goals. He or she will advocate for enablement of user goals throughout development cycles

documenting the users and user goals in User Persona Maps and User Goal Diagrams, and the metrics and dimensions/attributes in a Business Dimensional Model

documenting source-to-target definitions and logic/calculations

seeking to understand how organizational influences support or prohibit progress, and diligently and politely works through the process, with tenacity and integrity

working directly with the development team to communicate requirements, design, and develop the solution, and engage with development team members to elicit internal alignment and excitement around the Who, What, Why

testing of applications for data accuracy, logic definition, aesthetics, and function, documenting bugs and driving to closure

seeking to continually communicate progress internally and with our clients for alignment, and to evangelize the solutions, ensuring the identification of client stewards that align to and are excited about the solution (its capability to solve business problems)



Required Qualifications

❖ Active listening

❖ Intuitive skills for observation of organizational influences and capability to apply learnings to make progress

❖ Critical thinking to assimilate conversations, documentation, and knowledge into meaningful outputs

❖ High conversation and communication skills - both written (for email, documentation, presentations, etc.) and verbally (on video / phone meetings or in person) to continually define and evangelize the Who, What, Why

❖ Experience with discussions, specifically around the elicitation of business requirements from senior business leaders to managers, analysts, and line operators

❖ Experience with integrating with development teams through the development process

❖ Experience developing and executing test plans and seeking resolution

❖ Experience with establishing and managing requirements backlog / future phases

❖ Experience with extracting data (through SQL, Excel, etc.) for testing and analysis

❖ Bachelor's degree (minimum)


Preferred Qualifications

❖ User goal diagramming

❖ User persona mapping

❖ Experience with data visualization techniques

❖ Experience with translating high-level business requirements into meaningful, visual wireframes

❖ Business Intelligence Experience / MicroStrategy / Qlik / PowerBI / Tableau experience

❖ Understanding of and experience with the capabilities of data visualization tools and data acquisition techniques

❖ Familiarity with wireframing with tools such as Pencil, Balsamiq, PowerPoint, Photoshop, etc.


Additional Details

❖ Travel may be required

Job Title : Business Analyst 5

Location: 7285 Parsons Drive, Dimondale, Michigan – 48821 – Hybrid

(Will need to be onsite starting day 1 for hybrid work schedule.)

Duration: 1 year with possible extension.

Job Description:

The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering and documenting clear, unambiguous, and testable business requirements from the client, and understanding the business requirements thoroughly to communicate business need and system functionality to technical and non-technical stakeholders, project team members, and the user community. The resource will be responsible for working with the project team and stakeholders to examine existing and future-state business processes, data, and systems. This information is used to guide the gathering of business requirements as they relate to the desired system functionality.

Responsibilities

Responsible for documenting business requirements that are clear, unambiguous, testable, and satisfy the business need in accordance with standard templates and adherence to DTMB and Treasury policies, standards, and guidelines.
Responsible for facilitating requirement gathering meetings to identify impacted business processes and document the project business requirements. Attendees include relevant project team members and stakeholders as identified in the Communication Plan.
Responsible for adhering to the project schedule by developing and maintaining the project backlog during Agile projects and working with the product owner to set priority throughout the duration of project.
Responsible for understanding project scope and actively monitoring requirements process to maintain adherence to the objectives set for the project.
Responsible for understanding high-level information governance objectives and ensuring appropriate Stakeholder inclusion and/or awareness regarding data requirements.
Responsible for appropriate resolution of critical IT issues as it pertains to the BA role.
Responsible for understanding project specific benefits and related impact of changes to project scope or business requirements.
Ensures SEM deliverables for the project that are a responsibility of the BA are completed, reviewed, and approved in alignment with area processes.
Works directly with project team including user interface/user experience (UI/UX) designers, tech leads, solution architects, database administrators, developers, QA testers, and technical writers to ensure understanding of the requirements, functionality, size, and scalability of the IT solution.

MUST have Testing experience.

MUST have ADO/ADO Test Plan Experience.

5+ Years BA Experience required.

Description

In this role, you will interact with sales leaders, business partners and other stakeholders to develop and deliver performance reporting and insights. Build and modify SQL queries using SAS, R, or Python to create data sets for reporting and analysis
Design, build and maintain Tableau Dashboards and Reports
Utilize data to create insights to help leaders deepen their understanding of performance, gain efficiencies and improve bottom line performance
Perform ad hoc analysis, dashboards and reporting as needed to support leadership and business partners
Build and maintain strong working relationships across departments and teams

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Finance, Marketing, Business Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field
0-5 years of experience in a business intelligence or analyst role
1+ years working with SQL

Preferred Qualifications:

Developing or proficient in SAS, R or Python
Developing or proficient in Tableau
Strong data visualization skills to display complex data sets in a simple way
Experience pulling, cleaning, and validating data from disparate source systems
Background in Financial Services, particularly within Commercial segment or Data organization
Experience with Salesforce.com or comparable CRM
Strong Interpersonal skills
Ability to manage competing priorities in a matrix organization
Experience with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel

As the Senior Payroll Analyst, you will prepare, document and disburse payroll checks, payroll taxes and employee benefit payments. You will also prepare reports illustrating payroll expenditures, including such items as tax payments and benefit plan disbursements.

**This is a hybrid position, that would require you to be in the office 1-3 days a week, depending on business needs. **

Who We Want:

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes –finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.
Collaborative partners. Individuals who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions and contribute to successfully delivery of business.
Analytical problem solvers. People Individuals who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

What You Will Do:
Accurately manage and process payroll for approximately 30k plus employee population in accordance with all laws and company policies. As myHR payroll support, administer, evaluate, troubleshoot and communicate payroll explanations as part of the HR Operations model. Provide exceptional service to employees and managers needing assistance while ensuring appropriate communication with various stakeholders.
Oversee and backup team with the execution of the weekly and semi-monthly processing of payroll, which will include running defensive queries against employee data and organizational data that is used in the payroll process, reviewing time transactions, running payroll, auditing payroll results, correcting errors, and distributing payroll.
Responsible for reviewing, analyzing, reconciling and interpreting payroll data as it relates to payroll taxation, garnishments, and regulatory compliance for multi-state payroll processing, including reviewing interfaces to ADP applications and third parties.
Responsible for researching laws and regulation regarding taxes and payroll withholding procedures.
Partner with HR in the payroll preparation, audit and distribution process to ensure accurate pay for inputs outside of regular payroll processing.
Works in service driven environment, ensures appropriate case management documentation utilizing myHR portal.
Independently research, analyze data, and resolve escalated or complex payroll inquiries and issues as assigned through the myHR portal. Independently manage HR projects that impact the end-to-end payroll process as a functional team member, tester, documenter, and SME on payroll processes.
Act as liaison between myHR payroll and the International Assignments group to process all payroll related entries including monthly, quarterly and year end reporting and reconciliation.
Act as liaison between myHR payroll and NEI regarding monthly, quarterly and year end relocation processing including validation of proper taxation encompassing all US relocation packages.
Research and analyze payroll tax matters to determine and resolve payroll discrepancies by collecting information and analyzing liabilities through the calculating of employee income and employee/employer tax liabilities.
Work with Payroll Manager to contribute to the ongoing development and maintenance of payroll practices and procedures for accuracy, compliance and process improvements for effectiveness and efficiency.
Provides exceptional customer service to employees by maintaining contact via channel agreed upon between advisor and employee.
Assist Lead Analyst with internal and external annual SOX 404 audit, prepare and analyze payroll reporting. Work closely with internal partners to provide ad hoc payroll analysis as assigned.
Maintain payroll records and documentation; perform ongoing data audits, reviews, and analysis; including SOX requirements.
Ensure compliance under federal, state and local tax laws, as well as company policies and procedures.
Compile and submit reports as necessary.
Provide monthly cash reconciliation and resolve differences in partnership with finance teams.
Demonstrate best practices with the divisional finance teams in assisting with the reconciliation of general ledger payroll entries.
Manage integration efforts for employees joining company via merger or acquisition.
Exemplify team attitude and willingness to support others in need of assistance.
Initiates and completes significant and relevant special projects from beginning to end professionally, accurately and effectively with little to no supervision.
Work cross-functionally with other teams in the myHR Operations and COE centers
Collaborate with divisional finance partners to resolve reconciliation items as well as identify and implement process improvements and efficiencies.
Responsible for providing time sensitive payroll data for Stock Options/RSU processing; validation of correct taxation set-up to record and remit taxation to appropriate federal, state, and local agencies.
Process and review year-end statements such as W-2’s, W-2C’s and other related filings accurately and timely.
Validate payroll reconciliation and processing of monthly, quarterly, and annual tax filings. Ensure accurate payroll funding occurs for all accounts and payroll taxes are remitted on time.
Assist in the management of new state (and local) accounts for wage and tax reporting purposes. Research and resolve payroll tax issues.
Responsible for the ADP Tracer process, including handling mail correspondence, coordination of tracers with ADP, reviewing the monthly tracer report and determining the course of action needed.
Act as functional lead in performing regression and other testing of system changes as needed to ensure accuracy of system maintenance and/or enhancements.

What You Need:

Bachelor's degree required
2+ years of work experience required
Previous business-facing HR, HR COE, HR Operations, or role-related experience preferred.
Demonstrated expertise in payroll systems; preferred experience with ADP systems and Workday payroll preferred.
Tax filing experience with knowledge of federal, state, and local government payroll tax regulations; to include wage garnishments preferred.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Type: Full-time

Company Description:

Our client is a dynamic and rapidly growing manufacturing organization dedicated to providing innovative solutions to our clients. We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong background in finance, expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), and proficiency in Power BI. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial insights and enhance business performance, we want to hear from you.

Business Analyst Job Summary:

As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing financial processes, analyzing data, and providing actionable insights to support strategic decision-making. Your primary responsibilities will include working with financial data, utilizing D365 for financial analysis and reporting, and leveraging Power BI to create visually engaging and informative dashboards. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to drive improvements in financial operations and contribute to the overall success of the organization.

Key Responsibilities of the Business Analyst:

Utilize Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) to extract, transform, and analyze financial data.
Develop and maintain financial models to support forecasting, budgeting, and financial planning.
Create interactive and visually appealing reports and dashboards using Power BI to communicate key financial metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements for financial analysis and reporting.
Perform variance analysis, trend analysis, and financial performance evaluations to identify opportunities for improvement.
Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis as requested by senior management.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency in financial reporting.
Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in finance and data analytics.
Provide training and support to end-users on D365 and Power BI functionalities.
Participate in cross-functional teams and contribute to strategic financial projects.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation in financial workflows.

Qualifications needed for Business Analyst:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Financial Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) for Finance and Operations.
Strong expertise in Power BI for creating interactive reports and dashboards.
Solid understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
Prior experience in the financial services industry is a plus.
Relevant certifications in D365 and Power BI are a strong asset.

Benefits:

Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and retirement plans.
Opportunities for career growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Access to cutting-edge financial technologies and tools.

If you are a proactive and results-driven Financial Business Analyst with a passion for leveraging D365 and Power BI to drive financial insights, we invite you to apply.

Responsible for inventory counting, reconciliation, and reporting metrics
Drive improvements by optimizing inventory presentation for improved flow
Provide analysis, modeling, insights for the optimization or reduction of inventory

's degree in Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or a related field or equivalent 3 years of relevant warehouse Inventory Control experience in lieu of degree
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Department: Information Technology
Work Type: Staff - Full Time
Location: Main Campus (Houghton, MI)
Full Time / Part Time: Full Time
Categories: Information Technology


Department: Information Technology

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Michigan Technological University is an Equal Opportunity Educational Institution/Equal Opportunity Employer that provides equal opportunity for all, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

If you require any auxiliary aids, services, or other accommodations to apply for employment, or for an interview, at Michigan Technological University, please notify the Human Resources office at 906-487-2280 or humanresources@mtu.edu.

Job Description Summary


As a member of the Information Systems and Services Team within Information Technology, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for information, data, data visualization and data governance. Primary responsibilities include supporting business processes, documenting procedures, loading data, sending bulk email communications, writing reports and processing access requests. You will become part of a culture that empowers employees, treats them with respect, and encourages innovation and open communication.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned)


Review questions/issues with supported software and determine if the software is working as intended. Follow-up with the vendor and campus partners as needed
Create and execute queries/reports using the campus software reporting tools. Including but not limited to WebFOCUS and SQL Developer
Prepare and execute test plans to ensure desired results are achieved
Develop and maintain training and documentation for supported software and associated business processes as needed
Analyze business processes, define and document business process requirements and assist with implementation of business process initiatives
Review/understand university processes/procedures and make recommendations for improvements
Maintain university data dictionary
Process access requests for Banner and related systems
Process data loads
Generate bulk email communications
Prioritize work inline with institutional expectations
Work independently and as part of a team
Other duties as assigned
Apply safety-related knowledge, skills, and practices to everyday work
Commit to learning about continuous improvement strategies and applying them to everyday work. Actively engage in University continuous improvement initiatives


Required Education, Certifications, Licensures (minimum requirements)


Bachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science, management information systems or technically related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired


Required Experience (minimum requirements)


One year of experience using a query based reporting tool (e.g. Webfocus or Tableau)
One year of experience writing SQL queries
Demonstrated understanding of relational databases and standard query languages
Understanding of enterprise level computer systems (e.g. Banner, PeopleSoft, SalesForce)


Desirable Education and/or Experience


One year of experience with emphasis on business systems or process analysis
Experience using Banner software
Experience in a higher education environment
Experience using WebFOCUS
Experience with data governance


Required Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities (minimum requirements)


Demonstrated ability to analyze data, processes, and complex situations to determine a best course of action
Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills
Excellent organizational skills and ability to balance multiple priorities and objectives
Excellent interpersonal, customer service and oral/written communication skills and the ability to document business needs in both technical and non-technical terminology at a variety of skill levels
Demonstrated ability to work with accuracy, precision, and attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to use judgment when dealing with confidential information
Demonstrated ability to deliver results effectively either working independently or on a team
Demonstrated ability to learn new software
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively across cultural boundaries and work harmoniously with diverse groups of students, faculty, and staff
Integrate safety practices into daily activities
Ability to learn all federal, state, and institutional requirements and laws impacting the delivery of services and systems


Desirable Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities


Experience working on projects in a project management environment


Work Environment and/or Physical Demands


Work Environment and/or Physical Demands:*

The work environment is that of a typical office setting.
The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.
Ability to lift up to 40 pounds.

Personal Protective Equipment (PPE):*
None required.

Employee Safety Overview

Annual Data Security Training
Annual Title IX Training

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Mt. Clemens, MI
Job Description:
Since 1974, SVS Vision has helped our customers lead better lives through better vision. As a Michigan-based company with over 80+ offices in 9 states, we have grown to be one of the largest optical companies in the Midwest with the help of our devoted employees. We are a family-oriented company that takes pride in recognizing and rewarding our employees for their hard work and dedication. We trust our company philosophy makes for an exciting and fun work environment where our employees can thrive while providing the best customer service possible. Our pledge to our employees has never wavered, as seen in our remarkable longevity with the opportunities for growth within the company, above-market salaries, and exceptional benefits. Additionally, SVS offers an employee referral bonus where you are awarded substantial additional earnings for qualified employee referrals.


Business Intelligence Analyst

At SVS Vision, we are in search of a dynamic and forward-thinking Business Intelligence Analyst to join our finance team. We are a company dedicated to innovation and growth, and we firmly believe that data-driven insights are the cornerstone of our success. As a Business Intelligence Analyst (BI Analyst), you will be at the forefront of our efforts to tackle everyday business challenges, make well-informed decisions, and unearth new avenues for expansion.

Key Responsibilities:

Create visually appealing and informative reports and dashboards in Qlik, Power BI, Amazon QuickSight.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven recommendations for improving business strategies and addressing critical issues.
Work on data integration projects to streamline data from different sources and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Utilize predictive modeling techniques to forecast trends, customer behavior, and market dynamics.
Assist in data architecture, report architecture, dashboard reconfiguration and re-establishing data refresh and other ad hoc reporting.
Performs maintenance programming and correction of identified defects.
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations
Other daily tasks include, but not limited to, gathering business requirements for new deployment environment, assisting with dashboards bugs and testing, Complaint Qlik development, training sessions with the users, testing system architecture to ensure data quality and other ad hoc data delivery requests from process owners.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Overall, 5+ Years of experience in BI/Reporting
Minimum 3+ Years of experience required in Qlik, Power BI, Amazon QuickSight Dashboard development
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience in SQL databases on a cloud data warehouse environment
Extensive knowledge in various reporting objects and it include Facts, Attributes, Hierarchies,
Excellent analytical, organization, prioritization and verbal and written communication skills.

Why SVS Vision?:

A strategic role with the opportunity to shape the financial future of our business.
A supportive and innovative work environment.
Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package.
Ongoing professional development and training opportunities.
The chance to collaborate with a passionate and dedicated finance team.

If you are a resourceful and analytical individual who is eager to contribute to the financial growth of our organization, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us on this exhilarating journey and become an integral part of our success story!

Business Analyst - Onsite

Client: State of Michigan - DTMB

Location: Lansing, MI

Position Justification
(Why this resource is being procured and which MDHHS applications/projects/other areas this resource will be working on)"The position is responsible for providing ongoing maintenance and support for HIV/STI applications supported within our department. These applications are part of the Bureau of Public Health program area. The resource is integral to supporting and improving MDHHS automated processes, streamlining critical business processes, data integrity, SEM/SUITE compliance, and securing the applications. As a lead, the resource participates in a variety of assignments that provides for the enhancement, integration, maintenance, and implementation of projects. The resource also provides application oversight to business analysts in the team that support other applications in the Public Health Area. Not having a resource on staff will delay ongoing and future project work within the Public Health area and lead to DTMB inability to deliver on priotized enhancements and maintenance from our partners in MDHHS.

Position Summary

Write high level functional requirement documents.
Perform business requirements analysis conduct gap analysis and develop well defined detailed functional requirements.

Design, develop, and implement test plans and test reports for applications or subsystems.

Monitors applications during peak production times.

Delivering product and service based upon the core concepts of business analysis.

How to Apply

A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should specifically address your interest in the position and outline particular skills and experience that directly relate to this position.

Summary

We are seeking a Data Security Analyst to join Computing and Multimedia Technologies (CMT) at the Survey Research Center (SRC) of the Institute for Social Research (ISR). CMT provides an opportunity to work in a collaborative team with the mission of providing excellent customer service in support of social science research and data collection.

The Data Security Analyst monitors, evaluates, and maintains systems and procedures to protect the SRC and ISR information systems, networks, and data. They will report to the Director of CMT.

Why Work at Michigan?

In addition to a career filled with purpose and opportunity, U-M offers a comprehensive benefits package to help you stay well, protect yourself and your family, and plan for a secure future. Benefits include generous time off; retirement plan with two-for-one matching contributions after the first year; many choices for comprehensive health insurance; life insurance; long-term disability coverage; and flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses. Learn more about U-M benefits.

Responsibilities*

Research and document NIST, CJIS, and other information security standards as part of project compliance and certification processes. Review audit results and implement changes to procedures and technical systems to ensure requirements are successfully met.

Work with technical staff to implement information security plans, processes, and procedures. Act as a liaison to U-M Information Assurance and greater U-M security community.

Collaborate with stakeholders to identify security issues and possible solutions. Define new security processes in consultation with research project staff. Communicate status updates with technical staff, project staff, and faculty regarding security projects, tasks, and process changes.

Perform systems and website vulnerability scanning and assist technical staff with vulnerability remediation and other relevant security procedures. Monitor, evaluate, and audit systems and procedures to ensure that information systems are in compliance with the applicable security standards.

Identify, evaluate, and implement information security tools and processes which support compliance with required information assurance standards and improve organizational data security.

Provide guidance and training to project staff and operations technical staff to ensure that users are prepared for and understand security procedures and standards.

Perform security incident handing procedures in the identification, containment, and remediation of incidents. Consult with faculty and staff to recommend corrective actions to mitigate future data security breaches.

Required Qualifications*

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or an equivalent combination of education, certifications and experience is required.

5 years of experience securing electronic information technology, network environments, and computer systems in a Microsoft Windows environment.

Experience with Microsoft Active Directory and Group Policy.

Experience documenting systems and procedures to support regulatory compliance requirements.

Knowledge of security incident handling practices and experience assisting technical staff with incident handling.

Demonstrated knowledge of information security concepts, procedures and practices.

Demonstrated knowledge of networking protocols and an understanding of security related technologies including encryption, VPN, Firewalls, etc.

Desired Qualifications*

Experience with desktop computer support or server administration.

Experience securing systems in a commercial cloud environment.

Experience with website vulnerability scanning and remediation.

Security-focused certifications such as SANS, CISSP, or similar.

Work Locations

This position allows flexibility for a hybrid work environment but will require regularly scheduled on-site work to provide incident response and remediation.

Underfill Statement

This will be filled at the senior level salary range of $95,000-110,000. Candidates with lesser experience are encouraged to apply and may be considered at the intermediate level with a salary range of $70,000-85,000.

Additional Information

This position will require access to federal project data and systems, some of which are subject to security clearance and training requirements. The Data Security Analyst may be asked to demonstrate information security knowledge in the above areas by successfully completing a security certification. Candidates must agree to submit to SRC-funded background and security checks and be able to obtain security clearance (up to federal level 5) within 6 (six) months of hire. Please be advised that current federal security clearance requirements limit level 5 clearance to U.S. citizens.


The Institute for Social Research (ISR) at the University of Michigan seeks to recruit and retain a diverse workforce as a reflection of our commitment to serve the diverse people of Michigan, to maintain the excellence of the university, and to ground our research in varied disciplines, perspectives, and ways of knowing and learning.

Background Screening

The University of Michigan conducts background checks on all job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background checks. Background checks are performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Application Deadline

Institute for Social Research job openings are posted for a minimum of fourteen (14) calendar days. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled any time after the minimum posting period has ended.

U-M EEO/AA Statement

The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

transform and integrate data from multiple internal and external data sources.

Embedded controller programming tools.

Job Description Summary


Responsible for a broad range of activities involving data collection, analysis and reporting through the design, development, and maintenance of various interactive university dashboards. Gathers and analyzes complex statistical educational data and disseminates information in a variety of formats to campus administrators and external reporting agencies to support management, planning, student success, assessment and policy development activities. Contributes to the ongoing data governance process and promotes and ensures data integrity and consistency across multiple data domains and reporting contexts within the University.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned)


1. Duties include collection, extraction, and manipulation of data from various sources; conduct statistical studies to interpret data and translate it into clear, usable, and actionable information; effectively visualize and communicate information derived from data to a broad range of campus leaders through interactive dashboards and/or reports to support the University’s operational and managerial decision-making, as well as strategic planning processes; instruct users on data and system literacy; and perform required documentation efforts.

2. Provide ad hoc research requests from the campus community, complete various institutional/external surveys (i.e. U.S. News, National Science Foundation, etc.), execute data protocols, and serve as a liaison in ongoing data governance activities.

3. May participate on University committees and task forces.

4. Commit to learning about continuous improvement strategies and applying them to everyday work. Actively engage in University continuous improvement initiatives.

5. Apply safety-related knowledge, skills, and practices to everyday work.

Experience working with the technical and functional aspects of Ellucian BANNER.


Experience using WebFocus, Oracle and SQL*Plus™.

Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills.

Demonstrated self-motivation and strong organizational skills.


Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively across cultural boundaries and work harmoniously with diverse groups of students, faculty, and staff.


Demonstrated commitment to contribute to a safe work environment.

Summary

NOTE: This is a term-limited appointment ending July 2026, with the possibility of extension contingent on continued funding, your satisfactory performance and conduct, and the availability of work.

The Division of Undergraduate Education is seeking a Research Area Specialist Senior to support various student success initiatives and research projects in the College of LSA and at the university. This position reports to the Associate Dean for Undergraduate Education, with functional supervision by the ASSET-LSA Initiative Director. Student success topics addressed may include questions of equity and student success in admissions, recruitment, financial aid, student support, advising, degree structures, transfer articulation, time to graduation, curricular and non-curricular experiences, graduate and professional education, and life outcomes. The student success initiatives are guided and informed by a steering committee which includes the Provost, the Vice Provost for Equity and Inclusion, the Vice President for Student Life, the Vice Provost for Enrollment Management, and the Vice Provost for Academic and Budgetary Affairs. A group of faculty members with relevant expertise (Economics, Sociology, Public Policy, Education, Computer Science, Physics) also provides University leadership with an effective avenue for conducting world class research.

Mission Statement

The mission of the University of Michigan is to serve the people of Michigan and the world through preeminence in creating, communicating, preserving and applying knowledge, art, and academic values, and in developing leaders and citizens who will challenge the present and enrich the future.

Why Work at Michigan?

In addition to a career filled with purpose and opportunity, the University of Michigan offers a comprehensive benefits package to help you stay well, protect yourself and your family and plan for a secure future. Benefits include:

Generous time off, including vacation time, sick time, holiday and season days

A retirement plan that provides two-for-one matching contributions with immediate vesting

Many choices for comprehensive health insurance

Life insurance

Long-term disability coverage

Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses



In addition, LSA provides:

Strong commitment to work/life balance

Flexible work arrangements with respect to campus stakeholder needs



Being part of something greater, of serving a larger mission of discovery and care, that's the heart of what drives people to work at Michigan. In some way, great or small, every person here helps to advance this world-class institution. It's adding a purpose to your profession. Work at Michigan and become a victor for the greater good.

Responsibilities*

This position will serve as project manager for research projects conducted under the student success initiative and have responsibilities in a number of areas, including study planning and implementation; data collection, aggregation, cleaning, processing, management, and analysis; and dissemination (along with other possible duties).

Responsibilities include the following:

Project Management. Planning work plans, data gathering and analysis. Planning and managing timelines and deliverables for a variety of student success initiatives. Organizing and coordinating the work of teams and other researchers.
Data processing, management, and analysis. Lead the collection, processing, merging, managing and archiving data; designing databases and entering data into databases; analysis of longitudinal data; documenting all data processing steps; creating indices and other summary variables; creating, maintaining, and archiving survey and other study documentation; and performing both basic and complex social science statistical analysis.
Dissemination and communication. Responsibilities include assisting in drafting memos, presentations, briefs, and reports; assisting in creating and maintaining web-based resources using data visualization tools such as Tableau; working with graphic designers and printers to produce and distribute reports; presenting findings to a variety of audiences. Liaison with research partners across the University.
Research Administration. Complete IRB research applications ensuring compliance with University regulations, maintain data agreements and data security, and will also draft and manage project reports for University leadership, maintain project records, and other administrative duties.
Other duties as assigned.



Required Qualifications*

Master's degree in public policy, education, political science, economics, or a relevant social science discipline.
Five years of relevant experience in data analysis or related research experience.
Demonstrated knowledge of and interest in educational structures, equity, and policy.
Significant knowledge of social science research methods and concepts.
Substantial experience with R, Python, and/or STATA, for both data management and analysis operations.
Experience with SQL and constructing SQL queries in institutional databases.
Experience with large, complex data sets.
Prior experience with data visualization software, Tableau preferred.
Thorough understanding of program evaluation concepts and practices.
Personal commitment to high quality work.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
Attention to detail.
Strong organizational skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
The ability to multitask and prioritize efforts across multiple simultaneous projects.
The ability to work both as part of a team and individually while meeting deadlines.



Desired Qualifications*

A doctoral degree in a related field.
Six or more years of relevant experience, preferably in higher education or student-centered organization.
Strong familiarity with state and national educational datasets including IPEDS, National Student Clearinghouse, and Department of Education surveys (e.g., NPSAS) and civil rights data collections.
Advanced experience working on multiple phases of quantitative research projects (field operations, data management, analysis, dissemination).
Current knowledge of trends affecting higher education, particularly those related to student success and diversity, equity, and inclusion.
Coursework in public policy and education.
Coursework in program evaluation.



Additional Information



As one of the world's great liberal arts colleges, LSA pushes the boundaries of what is understood about the human experience and the natural world, and we foster the next generation of rigorous and empathetic thinkers, creators, and contributors to the state of Michigan, the nation, and the world.


To learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion in LSA, please visit lsa.umich.edu/lsa/dei.


To learn more about LSA's Mission, Vision and Values, please visit lsa.umich.edu/strategicvision.

Our Corporate office in Livonia, Michigan is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst-WMS our Information Technology team. As a WMS Senior Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, designing, and optimizing warehouse management solutions. Your expertise in WMS systems, specifically Blue Yonder (formerly JDA) and the Blue Yonder Luminate platform, will contribute to the successful implementation and continuous improvement of warehouse operations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, business stakeholders, and IT departments to understand requirements, develop strategies, and drive adoption.




Non-Negotiable Traits:

To perform the job successfully, the incumbent’s behavior must be consistent with the five Non-Negotiable Traits expected of all Mastronardi Produce employees: Be passionate; have absolute integrity; be self-motivated and determined; be a team player and behave as a professional.




Primary Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their warehouse management needs, challenges, and objectives.
Analyze, document, and translate business requirements into technical specifications for WMS systems, including process flows, data requirements, and system functionalities.
Work closely with IT teams to configure, customize, and integrate the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform, aligning them with business processes and objectives.
Conduct a comprehensive gap analysis to identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions to enhance WMS operations.
Lead the implementation and upgrade projects of Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform, collaborating with third-party vendors, implementation partners, and internal teams.
Define and execute system testing strategies, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to ensure system functionality and data accuracy.
Develop and deliver training programs and materials to end-users, ensuring effective adoption and utilization of the WMS system.
Monitor and support the production environment, addressing system issues, data discrepancies, and user inquiries related to the Blue Yonder WMS system.
Analyze and interpret data from the WMS system to provide insights and recommendations for process improvements and operational efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies for inventory management, order fulfillment, and warehouse optimization.
Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in warehouse management systems, specifically Blue Yonder and Luminate platform.
Participate in strategic planning and roadmap discussions, providing insights and recommendations on WMS-related initiatives and technologies.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and implement data integration strategies, ensuring seamless data exchange between the WMS system and other business applications.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the performance, scalability, and usability of the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform.
Conduct post-implementation reviews to assess the effectiveness of WMS solutions and identify opportunities for further optimization.
Act as a subject matter expert on the Blue Yonder WMS system and Luminate platform, providing guidance and support to junior analysts and end-users.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and implement strategies for system enhancements, upgrades, and expansions.
Foster strong relationships with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external vendors to ensure effective communication and alignment of WMS initiatives with business goals.
Maintain documentation of system configurations, processes, and user guidelines to facilitate knowledge sharing and support future enhancements.



Qualifications & Experience:

Bachelor's or master's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) as a WMS Business Analyst or in a similar role, with a focus on Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform.
Strong knowledge and experience in developing, configuring, and supporting Blue Yonder WMS and Luminate platform.
Familiarity with warehouse management processes, including receiving, put-away, picking, packing, shipping, and inventory management.
Proficiency in business process analysis and mapping, with the ability to identify process gaps and recommend improvements.
Experience in leading WMS implementation projects, including requirements gathering, system configuration, testing, and training.
In-depth understanding of supply chain operations, warehouse management principles, and industry best practices.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.
Experience in system integration, including data mapping, EDI, and API integrations with other business applications.
Solid understanding of database concepts and SQL queries, with the ability to extract and manipulate data from WMS systems.
Knowledge of Blue Yonder Luminate Control Tower and other supply chain visibility tools is a plus.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver them on time and within budget.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on identifying innovative solutions to complex business challenges.
Proven ability to work independently and in a team environment, with a high degree of self-motivation and initiative.
Ability to travel as required for project implementations and stakeholder meetings.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends and advancements in WMS technologies.

With around 480 locations in over 40 countries, thyssenkrupp Materials Services is the biggest materials distributor and service provider in the western world. The area of Materials Services spans two strategic areas: global materials distribution as one-stop-shop – from steel and stainless steel, tubes and pipes, nonferrous metals and specialty materials to plastics and raw materials – and tailored services in the areas of materials management and supply chain management. An extensive omnichannel architecture offers 250,000 customers worldwide cross-channel, round-the-clock access to more than 150,000 products and services. thyssenkrupp Materials NA is a subsidiary of the internationally operating thyssenkrupp Group.
