Description:

Position is mainly remote but must be able to come to Livonia office one week a month.

POSITION PURPOSE

Works in discovering the information hidden in vast amounts of data to help Informatics Analysts in presenting data to present to leadership allowing them to make smarter decisions to deliver even better performance of our THCE program. The primary focus is applying data mining techniques, doing advanced analysis, and building high quality ad hoc systems integrated with our operations. Automates scoring techniques to assist in department improvements, builds recommendation systems, improves and extends the features used by our existing applications, develops internal A/B testing procedures, builds system data integration between multiple applications, develops applications and reports to assist leadership in decision making process, create and automates reporting and processes to assist THCE team with performance.

Works closely with Trinity Information Services to ensure the CMMS Application servers are maintained and kept current. Provides first level support for any downtime occurrences. Leads processing of all patches and updates to the applications. Creates topic specific ad hoc applications within SQL and HTML to meet the needs of the operations, i.e. HTML Splash Page, automatic notifications, THCE Finance Application for budget building and Intercompany Transfer documentation, interfaces to/from (PeopleSoft, etc.).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Knows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices and decisions.

Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health Corporate Integrity Program, Code of Ethics, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.

Develops solutions to support relationship with System Office finance, purchasing and TIS to improve data mining and analytics to support THCE operations through the CMMS. Serves as data expert with all aspects of the CMMS including data structures and tables, and leads development of new end user tools.

Supports Business Application team in ensuring that the CMMS is in compliance with local, state and federal regulations, as well as with JCAHO EC, AOA, CAP, and ANSI/AAMI EQ standards.

Directly responsible for the management and administration of the CMMS Web Based work order entry and review component, as well as, any supporting hardware peripherals deployed to support the use of applications/systems, i.e. scanners/readers etc..

Directly responsible for CMMS troubleshooting, resolution, and coordinating/performing upgrades with Trinity Information System.

Directly responsible for analyzing, and maintaining standardized data tables.

Develops database-stored procedures to support operations and analytics.

Pro-actively analyzes, monitors, and creates reports to identify cost reduction, resource productivity, and service agreement expiration and compliance improvement.

Provides other database support to staff as needed, and completes all other tasks as assigned.

Possesses a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.

Maintains HIPPA compliance and confidentially of information received, pertaining to but not limited patient, physicians, and associates.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in business administration or information technology, or equivalent combination of education and experience; and five (5) years of progressively more responsible experience in data analytics or informatics. MBA and/or advanced degree is preferred. Experience in supply chain, finance/accounting, inventory control, production or purchasing is strongly preferred.

Must possess an in-depth knowledge of the system development lifecycle and an ability to develop appropriate methodologies for collecting, analyzing and evaluating large amounts of data.

Strong working knowledge of SQL, HTML, ServiceNow and database schema's. Proficient in the use of Excel, Visio, Access and PowerPoint is required.

Strong working knowledge of Computers including operating systems, advanced understanding of Wireless and Network Communications, and Web Based Application Development languages, i.e. html, java.

Must be comfortable with conflict and willing to challenge conventional thinking at all levels of the organization.

Must possess strong analytical skills, including ability to understand and define most critical issues and develop methodologies for collecting and analyzing relevant data (keep vs. buy, Total Cost Ownership (TCO), lease vs. buy, Net Present Value (NPV), Cost of Service Ratio (COSR), and so forth).

Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills in order to effectively discuss data analytics with diverse groups and prepare reports.

Must possess excellent organizational and planning skills.

Must be a self-starter with ability to juggle priorities and manage own work to completion.

Strong organizational and planning skills to support involvement in multiple projects simultaneously in an environment of competing priorities.

Must possess ability to be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.

Supports and executes strategies related to improving the reporting and analytic capabilities through facilitating detailed requirements gathering, report/dashboard testing, training and maintenance. Provides reporting support from SCIS (Supply Chain Information System) and other available systems such as DSS, SSID and 3rd party tools. Supports on boarding of merger and acquisition targets to the SCIS data environment.

Meticulous in attention to detail.

Must have a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS

Must be able to set and organize own work priorities, and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.

Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites as needed, less than 5% of the time.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion


Trinity Health is a family of 115,000 colleagues and nearly 26,000 physicians and clinicians across 25 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Our dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention, and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn

Job Title: Sr Specialist, Data Analytics - Fin Ops, Chargebacks
Job Description:
P29S98 - Title: Sr. Specialist, Analytics & Innovation, Fin Ops - Chargebacks

Job description summary

Analytics & Innovation, with a focus on Finance Operations - Chargebacks, is responsible for planning, developing, communicating, implementation, and managing/evaluating current processes; this involves working cross-functionally the company's internal resources. Works within the constraints of budget, schedule and scope while managing risk and ensuring adherence to established processes and methodologies.

What Data Analytics brings to Cardinal Health:

The Data & Analytics Function oversees the analytics life-cycle in order to identify, analyze and present relevant insights that drive business decisions and anticipate opportunities to achieve a competitive advantage. This function manages analytic data platforms, the access, design and implementation of reporting/business intelligence solutions, and the application of advanced quantitative modeling.

Data Analytics applies business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives.

The focus area of this role contributes to the success of Finance operations as it pertains to Chargebacks. This role will work cross-functionally with other internal resources to complete projects in a timely productive manner.

Qualifications

Minimum of 2 years experience
BA, BS or equivalent experience in related field preferred
SQL highly preferred
Alteryx highly preferred
Proficiency in Microsoft Office required
Tableau or similar Visualization Tool preferred
Experience with data management and data governance preferred
Project management experience preferred
Demonstrated attention to detail
Excellent communication skills
HANA, GCP, Vistex experience preferred

What is expected of you and others at this level

Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
Works on projects of moderate scope and complexity Identified possible solutions to a variety technical problems and takes action to resolve
Develops technical solutions to a wide range of problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
Applies judgment within defined parameters
Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
Receives general guidance and may receive more detailed instruction on new projects
Work reviewed for sound reasoning and accuracy
May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues

What is expected of you in this role

Constructs and articulates resource needs to deliver on project goals
Gain an understanding of how chargebacks processes work at a high level and the challenges chargebacks faces to help us imagine valuable solutions
Gain an understanding of the chargebacks data landscape and build valuable relationships with various teams involved with chargebacks data
Consults directly on data-driven solutions for new service offerings and strategic initiatives
Prepares and analyzes data. This can include: locating, profiling, cleansing, extracting, mapping, importing, transforming, validating or modeling
Applies query, data exploration and transformation, basic statistical methods and visualization techniques to create business insights or improve data quality
Produce, analyzes and shares insights from Key Performance Indicators
Serves as a trusted resource for broad and deep chargebacks subject matter expertise in the context of developing new business processes and technology solutions
Will be responsible for blueprinting existing processes to discover automation opportunities, exploring capabilities of new tools and technology, and integrating that technology into current and new business processes to streamline Data Management work streams
Work with cross-functional partners across our highly matrixed organization to understand both upstream inputs to, and downstream impact of, current and future processes
Communicates information so that it is easy to understand and influences others to take action based on the useful information provided.

Overview:

We are currently seeking a Bilingual Senior Financial Analyst who is fluent in both Japanese and English. This role requires a balance of financial planning and analysis with a focus on tax compliance. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in corporate tax, preferably with experience in an accounting/tax firm, and will be responsible for coordinating with outside accounting firms for the preparation of tax returns. This role requires mandatory attendance at the office for at least two days each week.

Key Responsibilities:

[Tax]

Primary responsibility is to coordinate with outside accounting firms for the preparation of tax returns.
Assist in tax planning and transfer pricing.
Regularly update the controller on tax compliance status and any issues that arise.

[Finance]

Assist in cash planning.
Prepare budgets and monthly and annual financial reports including balance sheets, profit and loss statements for management and the parent company in Japan.
Assist in the development and analysis of the annual budget process. Compile and review departmental budgets, taking into account actual performance, previous expenditures, and estimated expenses and income.
Consolidate a wide range of operating and financial projections needed to develop short-term and long-term business plans.
Regularly present financial reports to the controller and other members of the management team.

[Financial Accounting]

Play a major role in preparing US GAAP financial statements.
Communicate with group companies in relation to various reporting preparation.
Analyze and interpret financial information to help management make sound and informed business decisions.
Research and compile financial data from multiple sources. Examine trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments, and incurred obligations to predict future revenues and expenses.

[Managerial Accounting]

Audit the company’s accounting procedures, verify the accuracy of its financial and accounting records. Search for potential mismanagement, waste, and fraud. Ensure appropriate internal controls exist and are followed.
Review the company’s operations to evaluate and monitor the efficiency and effectiveness of accounting procedures. Ensure continued compliance with company policies and applicable laws and regulations.
Recommend changes to improve the company’s financial controls.
Regularly update the controller on internal control status and any issues that arise.

Must-Have Qualifications:

Fluency in both Japanese (both written and verbal) and English.
Experience in corporate tax, preferably with a background in an accounting/tax firm.
Ability to attend the office for at least two days per week.

Preferred Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or a related field.
A minimum of 5-7 years of accounting, finance or a related experience, including some international finance/accounting exposure.
Thorough knowledge of all areas of accounting and reporting, including budgets, general ledger, reconciliations, balance sheets, income statements, cash flow.
Proficient use of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) with strong Excel skills.

Demonstrated Abilities:

Excellent organizational, project management, time management skills.
Good communication skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to set priorities, manage multiple projects, meet deadlines.
Ability to interpret and analyze data trends.

RESPONSIBILITIES




Position Title: Business Analysis/Reengineering Senior
Position #:
Join the Global eCommerce Platform Product Group which drives online vehicle Shop/Buy experiences for Mustang Mach-E, and F-150 Lightning currently operating in 30+ markets across the world. We are the technical core of the eCommerce Platform, maintaining a strong engineering culture that encourages innovation, growth, and development. As a Global Functional Lead/Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Owners/Product Managers to define the functional requirements, conduct discovery sessions, gather customer requirements, and document and present to stakeholders while supporting the Global eCommerce Platform strategy. You will work closely with both the Product Owners/Product Managers and PDO teams and be a liaison to translate the business requirements to delivery teams to deliver improved shop and buy user journeys. Position Duties: • Seeking enthusiastic Business and Functional Analyst with Proficiency to talk in functional & data terms to product owners and the stakeholders • Leadership skills to manage ad-hoc analysis or design deep dives • Understanding the Agile development lifecycle and working experience with PDO teams • Defining and documenting the data exchange in an API/Microservices architecture space • Documenting technical solution and experience flows using various collaboration tools like Visio, Miro etc
Skills Required:
• Creating and maintaining functional requirements in partnership and collaboration with the product owners and obtaining sign-off • Act as an SME on the E2E Global eCommerce experience and support new market discovery • Responsible for working with the developers to ensure correct understanding of requirements and then owning the functional delivery end to end in an API/Micro services space • Defining testing requirements together with the QA team • Building and maintaining a relationship with businesses to ensure alignment with business requirements and project management resources • Establishing and operating within the governance (decision making) structure for the program/project and managing/escalating issues and risks. • Work with Stakeholders during UAT to ensure reports meet requirements and ensure all deliveries are signed-off
Experience Required:
• 10+ years experience with at least 3+ years of eCommerce experience as a Business and Functional Analyst • Experience working with a API/microservices driven architecture • Excellent documentation, analytical and problem-solving skills • Attention to detail and self-starter, with an ability to identify risks and issues early • Excellent communication, negotiation, networking, and influencing skills • Ability to work across multiple business groups and domains • Ability to work in a fast-paced agile and Rally based environment • Scaled Agile certification would be a plus

Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

Data Protection Analyst

What Information Security and Risk contributes to Cardinal Health

Information Technology oversees the effective development, delivery, and operation of computing and information services. This function anticipates, plans, and delivers Information Technology solutions and strategies that enable operations and drive business value.

Information Security and Risk develops, implements, and enforces security controls to protect the organization's technology assets from intentional or inadvertent modification, disclosure, or destruction. This job family develops system back-up and disaster recovery plans. Information Technology also conducts incident response, threat management, vulnerability scanning, virus management and intrusion detection and completes risk assessments.

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 50,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.

We currently have a full-time job opening for a seasoned Data Protection Analyst. This position can be either at our Dublin center or remote.

Job Overview:

The Data Protection Analyst will report to the Manager of the Data Protection Team at Cardinal Health. The bulk of the role will be focused on performing event remediation and the development of business-facing data protection processes. This analyst will also support the data protection engineers in developing and maintaining technology solutions to protect data and will receive direction on various initiatives from the Manager. The analyst will have direct contact with Data Protection tools including Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), GCP BigQuery, Proof-of-Concept Technologies and ultimately newer technologies to be adopted and operationalized by the team. This data protection analyst will also play a role as the SDM program is developed and continually aligned with the changing technological landscape as well as industry evolutions and trends.

Responsibilities include the following:

Perform analysis and remediation of event/incident traffic within multiple data protection platforms.
Continually look for opportunities to reduce the false positive rates in existing or new data protection controls.
Support the manager of data protection in the development of business support processes as part of relevant projects.
Review policies and the configuration of data protection tools to refine rulesets.
Collaborate with data protection team members and other IT teams to build and deploy security and monitoring controls for databases and develop data at rest processes for O365.
Assist data protection engineers with Google BigQuery reporting and analysis.
Determine current and anticipate future event remediation needs and support the development of security controls in collaboration with the data protection team.
Aid in educating business teams and application leaders on data identification, secure handling, storage, and transfer of sensitive data. This will be a joint effort with other data protection team members.
Assist the manager of data protection in streamlining data at rest remediation.
Support the technical lead and manager in collaboration across Information Security and Data Analytics teams to aid in the development, growth, and evolution of the SDM Program while advocating for Data Protection tools and techniques.


Required Qualifications:

Prior experience with industry DLP, CASB, data encryption and monitoring tools, and data protection best practices.
Demonstrated experience with incident remediation automation and data at rest process development, especially within O365 and GCP environments.
Demonstrated Information Security understanding and specifically industry best practices for the development of data protection processes.
One or more Information Security Certifications preferred: CISSP, CSSLP, CISM, CCSP, GSLC, GSEC, CISA, SSCP.
Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent work experience.
5-7 years of experience in related field

What is expected of you and others at this level?

Contributes to the development of policies and procedures related to data protection.
Supports the development of technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organizational goals.
Continues to support the development of sensitive data processes to improve Cardinal Health enterprise security posture.
Provides general guidance and best practices with respect to remediation opportunities.
Recommends new practices, processes, metrics, or models.
Acts as a mentor to less experienced colleagues performing event analysis.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Principal Risk Data and Analytics Analyst
Job Description:
SUMMARY:

The Principal Analyst is responsible for planning, organizing, directing, implementation, and leading department assignments with minimal direction from leadership. This position operates within broad objectives to ensure optimum utilization relative to Risk Adjustment for Prospective and Retrospective programs. This role researches, compiles, and analyzes appropriate and relevant data to identify opportunities to recommend and drive execution of process efficiencies in assigned market teams to achieve targeted levels of improvement in key operational performance metrics.

RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:

Responsible for the development and delivery of multiple concurrent projects/programs that encompass business process design and improvement specific to Risk Adjustment programs and performance.
Evaluate project performance and identify value drivers for Risk Adjustment initiatives and programs.
Develop processes to calculate and automate KPI's specific to Risk Adjustment as well as effectively communicate KPI's to internal stakeholders
Assists in monitoring initiatives, outcomes, and objectives to ensure goal attainment within defined parameters with minimal guidance from leadership.
Designs, develops, tests, and delivers solutions comprising of components, reports, and data stores per requested deliverable directions with minimal guidance from leadership.
Provides expertise in analytical methodology, including data analysis, used to facilitate data driven decision making, including the collection and monitoring of metrics used to assess, prioritize, and select improvement projects.
Initiates and leads problem solving efforts working closely with internal and external stakeholders.
Possesses and maintains an extensive comprehensive knowledge of Medicare Advantage Risk Adjustment business, products, programs to support overall strategy for accurate patient assessment relative to chronic conditions for overall model of care.
Manages and monitors multiple projects simultaneously by establishing project plans and objectives to ensure goal attainment within defined parameters and timelines.
Develops lines of communication to discuss/review results of analysis to management via reports/presentations and assists management in implementing programs that provide solutions.
Independently develops and plans reports, papers, and/or other materials in a clear and concise manner.
Acts as a liaison between corporate business areas and participates in group or market discussions.

This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.

EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Health Care, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field. Master’s degree in a related field is preferred. Relevant combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree.

EXPERIENCE:

Seven years experience in a related field, typically in two subject areas (e.g. process improvement, project planning, health care economics, health care policy, statistical modeling, business decisions, analysis, Medicare risk adjustment or business management).

SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:

Excellent analytical, planning, problem solving, verbal, and written skills to communicate complex ideas.
Excellent organization skills and ability to effectively multi-task in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
Ability to lead and facilitate cross functional teams and team meetings.
Working knowledge of project management disciplines and methods.
Excellent execution in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
Excellent knowledge and use of existing software packages such as Tableau, Access, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.
Excellent knowledge of data languages such as SQL, .net, T-Sql, SAS, HTML, java, VBA, etc.
Excellent analytical, organizational, planning, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.
Excellent ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Excellent ability to develop project management, meeting process, and presentation skills.
Excellent ability to work independently, within a team environment, and communicate effectively with employees and clients at all levels.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work is performed in an office setting with no unusual hazards.

Nurse Informaticist/Business Analyst - Ambulatory - Cerner

THE OPPORTUNITY

Total Systems Solutions Consulting Inc. https://totalsystems.ca is seeking a Nurse Informaticist/Business Analyst to work for our public sector client at the Island Health(IHealth) in the Province of British Columbia. This is a remote role and must be available 100% to work remote full-time 40 hours per week with availability Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm in the Pacific Time Zone.

The consultant is expected to start date is December 11, 2023 and the contract length is 3 months.

Project Context

The details of Island Health’sIHealth project can be found here: https://ihealth.islandhealth.ca.

Island Health is continuing to progress the iHealth initiative by expanding the implementation of Computerized Provider Order Entry (CPOE) in tertiary sites, activating next in Victoria General Hospital (VGH) and Royal Jubilee Hospital (RJH).

The CPOE stream encompasses the implementation of guided electronic ordering for diagnostic tests (including laboratory testing, point of care testing), medications and specialist referrals.

The IHealth team and senior clinical and medical leaders have agreed that Victoria General Hospital (VGH) will go live in mid-February 2024 and Royal Jubilee Hospital (RJH) will go live in mid-March 2024 with computerized provider order entry (CPOE) and a “closed-loop” medication administration and management system. Gorge Road Health Centre (GRHC) and South Island Surgical Centre (SISC) will activate with VGH.

Service Required

Nurse Informaticists required to support the localization and implementation of 2 general medical ambulatory clinics (Liver Clinic and Medical Genetics clinic).
Supporting requirements gathering and design for clinical localization.
Engagements with clinical unit leaders, staff, and physicians in supporting completion of the work deliverables.
Creating end to end clinical workflows.
Completing requirements gathering to populate DCWs.
Creating and executing test scripts for functional testing of design as well as regression testing of end to end workflow.
Documenting JIRA Decision and Change tickets to execute design and build work as well as decisions required to route through clinical/project governance.
Using Service NOW to coordinate build work with relevant build teams through organizations technical change process.
Working with education team to inform and validate education content creation for activation

Recent and relevant experience as Nurse Informaticist or Business Analyst in General Medical Ambulatory Clinics.
Relevant Cerner ambulatory experience with general medical ambulatory clinic design and implementation with a focus on end to end design.
Ability to engage with clinical staff and providers in a professional matter to elicit information and requirements to support:
workflow mapping
functional design (scheduling appointment books, quick orders pages, powerforms, dyndoc, position builds, orders to scheduling, etc.)
Ability to work with and develop/complete DCWs in collaboration with relevant partners in informatics and build teams.
Ability to create and execute functional and regression test scripts for clinics.
Ability to work independently and be self motivated as well as work as part of a larger diffuse team.
Ability to facilitate meetings and have excellent presentation skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, organizing workload and priorities.
Proficient use of excel, Visio, and PowerPoint.
Effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Ability to organize workload and priorities.
Must work PST Time and be available full time hours.
Experience working with CST Project in Vancouver, BC is a preferred asset, but not required.

AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior PLM Business Analyst (BA) will assist the PLM Business Solution Architect to consult and collaborate with business teams to capture and analyze current PLM business practices and systems, assist in architecting future state PLM solutions based on industry best practices enabled by computer-aided design (CAD), PLM and related technologies, and ensure technical alignment with AtriCure’s 3DExperience PLM platform. This role will partner with business stakeholders, Product Owners, SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The PLM BA plays a critical role in capturing business, functional, system level requirements and serves as the liaison between the business and the IT development team to ensure the end solution adequately meets all requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Assist the team in the design of future state PLM solutions (process models enabled by CAD, PLM and related technologies) based on industry best practices and aligned with Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform for the following areas: document management, quality management, advanced product configuration management, change control, managed CAD in PLM, systems engineering and requirements management, risk management (FMEAs), materials management and compliance, and integrations with CRM, ERP, MES, Reporting & Analytics platforms
Collaborate with business’ legacy system owners and IT to define the scope and requirements for migrating legacy PLM and CAD data to the configured 3DExperience application
Assist the team in archiving and retiring legacy systems and associated data
Perform basic mockups, configurations on the Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform to facilitate future state solutioning workshops and align with out-of-the-box capabilities to minimize configuration and customization effort
Work closely with the business Product Owner and PLM Solution Architect to author and refine Agile features and associated user stories with clear and accurate acceptance criteria definition.
Quality Assurance and Incident Resolution: Assist the team through authoring and executing test scripts for verification, validation and capture results. Communicate and help rectify gaps, bugs, missed requirements for the developed solution that are exposed during testing to ensure delivered solution meets all requirements
Assist Project Lead / Scrum Master to keep projects on schedule and hold team accountable to the AtriCure delivery process

Summary
We are looking for an Applications Analyst – Business Intelligence to participate in the analysis, design, development, deployment, and support of data feeds, conversions, integrations, and integrations related to system implementations, business intelligence (reports/dashboards/KPIs), and other operational needs. Primarily, this position will develop and maintain data feeds, conversions, integrations and integrations between application systems and databases using API, ETL, and similar processes and tools. In addition, this position will design, develop, deploy, and support the tools, data stores, cubes, models, stored procedures and queries to generate static and ad-hoc data queries, reports and dashboards for all business units and enterprise reporting needs. Intelligent water management and decision making is enhanced with system integration and data aggregation for reporting and the information and insights they bring to the surface. At GLWA we use system integration and BI to analyze asset management and operations performance, optimize work activities, perform data audits, increase collaboration, leverage data in disparate systems, and tell our story. Come join our dynamic BI team who are achieving exciting results using data and analytics technology.

Job Responsibilities

Develops requirements for and creates, tests and maintains data feeds, integrations and integrations between application systems and databases using batch file import/export, ETL, API, webhooks, webservices (REST/SOAP), and similar processes and tools
Collaborate with ancillary system analysts and users, and software vendors to understand and develop business and functional ETL and integration requirement
Participates in projects and other initiatives that have integration, integration and reporting components
Uses Power BI, with familiarity in SSRS, Tableau, Qlik, Oracle, Telerik, and/or other types of business reporting software
Designs, develops, deploys, and supports the tools, data stores, cubes, models, stored procedures, and queries necessary to generate static and ad-hoc data queries and reports
Designs, develops, implements, and supports new and existing reports for all business units and enterprise reporting needs
Performs basic data analysis and high-level data mining as necessary
Generates ad-hoc reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, clients, and/or other stakeholders
Assists with the support, maintenance and upgrade to production, testing and development environments as necessary
Consults and supports with internal customers to develop analyses which leads to actionable insights
Works with several large and complex data models and cubes
Understands different disaster recovery solutions for reporting systems
Collects and maintains classifications for data protection, disaster recovery or other purposes
Plans and implements reports archival/retention strategy
Maintains retention policies and performs archiving and/or purging activities in accordance with retention policies
Continues to learn and keep up to date with start-of-the-art technology through training, webinars and conferences related avenues
Required Education and Experience

Possess a domain-specific entry level certification (e.g. Certified Business Process Analyst, Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer, Certified Business Intelligence Professional, etc.) ; or combination of related work experience and education
Meet all of the requirements to advance to Applications Analyst Level 3 within three (3) years of Level 2 designation
Other Requirements

Ability to work irregular hours, commute to GLWA facilities and work sites, and respond to after hour emergencies and on-call responses

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

Job: GENERAL BUSINESS OPERATIONS

Organization: Higher Education

Schedule: FULL\_TIME

Overview:
At BISSELL, the Advanced Development team is largely responsible for the development of the next generation products addressing un-met consumer and BISSELL needs, consumer “jobs,” accepted frustrations, performance gaps, and other product benefits of value to consumers and BISSELL. The Technology Scouting Team is part of Advanced Development that is guided by consumer “Jobs to be Done” to look for re-applicable or nearly viable enabling technologies to integrate into BISSELL products. The Technology Scouting team is heavily focused on product and technology research and initial investigations and evaluations.

This is a hybrid role with the expectation to be in-office typically several days a week. Remote work is available and flexible while business needs are met. This role also requires up to 25% travel and evening call attendance as needed to support the global nature of business at BISSELL.

The Sr. Business Analyst is a critical member of the Advanced Development and Technology Scouting Teams and is responsible for several essential analyses and roles including:
Engaging with category marketing leads to curate and cultivate a comprehensive list of product category “jobs” worth doing. This is the guiding strategy defining meaningful and persistent “jobs” our products are hired to do for the consumer.
Assessing preliminary product or feature concepts for both consumer and BISSELL desirability and viability with the goal of creating a compelling value to consumer and BISSELL.
Travel to conferences, trade shows, and vendors of interest globally.
Collaborating across highly varied and cross functional resources both internal and external including both business/marketing and technical individuals.
Identifying a new (to BISSELL) enabling technology and connecting it to a priority or meaningful consumer “Job to be Done”.
Initiating and managing relationships with external suppliers of technologies and services - including initiating NDA’s, MTAs, and other agreements as needed to foster collaboration.
Participating in defining the technology scouting strategy and tactics including prioritizing the trade shows and conferences for the year.
Working with the technical team to investigate a technology’s useful potential and, upon that determination, engaging with the pre-GPD process and category leadership teams to quickly determine BISSELL’s desire to continue development.
Deliver summarized concept documentation connecting the core ideas of the technology, consumer relevancy, and results from concept engineering exercises, with support from technical staff.
Communication and synchronization with leadership in each business category concerning consumer jobs to be done and technology discovered to address those needs.
Broadly communicating technologies of interest to the greater technical community to increase BISSELL’s collective awareness of commercially available approaches that could be designed for BISSELL products.
Responsibilities:
Key member of Tech Scouting team.
Activating the BISSELL tech scouting strategy to connect commercially available external technologies to meaningful Jobs to be Done in BISSELL’s prioritized product categories.
Actively scout potential technologies to explore, assess, and deploy through virtual and in person interactions at trade shows and technology conferences. (up to 20% travel)
Lead the development and deployment of an intrapreneurial portal to tap into creative problems solvers across BISSELL’s global locations.
Working cross functionally with engineering, marketing, finance, and global purchasing to discern preliminary viability including cost, safety, regulatory and desirability with target consumers.
Advocate with the commercial teams to find the most appropriate first implementation.
Assemble compelling presentations, sell sheets, demonstrations, product concepts, or ideation cards to initiate pre-GPD prioritization from the global business unit.
Curate and cultivate relationships with external partners – initiate and manage to completion contracts such as NDA’s and MTA’s, identify the paths to “win-win” partnerships with potential technology suppliers.
Contribute to internal catalog of technologies. Systematically document technologies, vendors, methods, contacts, and applications.
Investigate techniques to use or deploy to validate concepts in the front end of product development.
Execute financial analysis of front-end technologies and BISSELL opportunities based on best available (often minimal) data.
Identify leading desirability/consumer and viability/financial risks associated with a project on its path to commercialization.
Present on behalf of the Tech Scouting team to upper management and key stakeholders as needed.
Actively participate in innovation and technology workshops and ideation sessions with cross functional teams geared towards idea generation and prioritization.
Prepare analysis with minimal or limited direction from manager and external customers.
Seek solutions to challenges and be able to evaluate among multiple plausible options.
Thrive in a hybrid work environment.
Qualifications:
Additional Responsibilities:
Cultivate an Innovation culture within BISSELL – globally across all disciplines (technical and non-technical).
Dissemination of commercial tech awareness across global PD&E by hosting technology classes (supplier executed and internally developed primers) to the broadest possible technical audience.
Active member of the broader Advanced Development Team participating in Advanced Development Critique meetings (AD Crits) Ideation sessions, problem solving brainstorms, and others.
Investigate process improvement on the front end (measures/test for validation – avoiding Type II errors while mitigating Type I errors) found externally that might work to help de-risk technology projects.
Other items as needed or assigned
Core Competencies:
Functional expertise in creating early-stage business cases.
General comprehension of a broad array of competencies – able to understand both the business needs as well as technical challenges.
Global business acumen.
Self-management.
Learning versatility – able to learn quickly across a wide array of subjects.
Results driven.
Judgement and decision making.
Continuous improvement.
Expectation to learn continuously and explore outside of primary discipline.
Required Experience/Education:
Bachelor’s Degree (business, marketing, finance, industrial design, products research).
Applied Experience: 2-5 years.
Preferred Experience(s):
Experience or familiarity with consumer products research.
Business plan creation and validation (early stage).
Experience on the front end of product development.
Skills required:
Strong math and analysis skills.
Experience using Excel for reporting and analysis and PowerPoint for presentations.
Adept at internet research.
Actively curious – capable and willing to learn and re-apply new things.
Capable of collaborating with a technology provider even with non-traditional applications in mind.
Leadership, communication, and negotiation skills
Relentless optimism
Able to thrive in ambiguity stemming from the nature of invention and discovery; targets are known but solutions are wide and non-obvious.
Strong interpersonal skills – able to foster connections and relationships both inside and outside of BISSELL.
Able to drive multiple projects simultaneously.
Able to curate contacts and expand personal and team resourcefulness.
Healthy objectivity – We value strong ideas that are loosely held.
Strong sociability – ability to travel independently, make new contacts and develop valuable business relationships.

Duties:

- Conduct research and analysis to support decision-making processes
- Collect and analyze data to identify trends and patterns
- Develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project scope
- Create project plans, timelines, and deliverables
- Monitor project progress and ensure timely completion
- Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations

Experience:

- Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Business, Economics, Statistics)
- Proven experience in data analysis and research
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
- Proficient in using analytical tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL)
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Project management experience is a plus

This is an exciting opportunity for an Analyst to contribute to the success of our organization by providing valuable insights through research, analysis, and project management. We offer competitive compensation, a supportive work environment, and opportunities for professional growth. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for data analysis and research, we would love to hear from you. Apply now!

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Type: Full-time

Company Description:

Our client is a dynamic and rapidly growing manufacturing organization dedicated to providing innovative solutions to our clients. We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong background in finance, expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), and proficiency in Power BI. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial insights and enhance business performance, we want to hear from you.

Business Analyst Job Summary:

As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing financial processes, analyzing data, and providing actionable insights to support strategic decision-making. Your primary responsibilities will include working with financial data, utilizing D365 for financial analysis and reporting, and leveraging Power BI to create visually engaging and informative dashboards. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to drive improvements in financial operations and contribute to the overall success of the organization.

Key Responsibilities of the Business Analyst:

Utilize Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) to extract, transform, and analyze financial data.
Develop and maintain financial models to support forecasting, budgeting, and financial planning.
Create interactive and visually appealing reports and dashboards using Power BI to communicate key financial metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements for financial analysis and reporting.
Perform variance analysis, trend analysis, and financial performance evaluations to identify opportunities for improvement.
Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis as requested by senior management.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency in financial reporting.
Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in finance and data analytics.
Provide training and support to end-users on D365 and Power BI functionalities.
Participate in cross-functional teams and contribute to strategic financial projects.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation in financial workflows.

Qualifications needed for Business Analyst:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Financial Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) for Finance and Operations.
Strong expertise in Power BI for creating interactive reports and dashboards.
Solid understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
Prior experience in the financial services industry is a plus.
Relevant certifications in D365 and Power BI are a strong asset.

Benefits:

Job Title: Senior Program Analyst - Ann Arbor, MI
Job Description:
Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking a qualified and motivated candidate for the position of Senior Program Analyst.

Labor Category: Senior Program Analyst - Ann Arbor, MI

Successful performance of a Program Analyst under this requirement requires a wide variety of associated duties including research, analysis, systems thinking, data entry, writing, document preparation, editing, scanning, document management, copying, phone calls, faxing, filing, and other activities as necessary to complete the tasks assigned. Contractor Personnel are required to provide data input/extraction and ongoing support of the data systems for VHA Procurement Regional Procurement Offices (RPOs) and Network/Program Contracting Activity. Program Analysts may also be expected to analyze a wide variety of data from conceptualization through presentation of the data to the RPO Program Analyst team.

Responsibilities:

Assists in designing, coordinating, developing, and documenting proposed organization designs, and/or changes in business/programmatic processes, procedures, and/or products.
Performs initial reviews of existing processes, procedures, and/or products.
Gathers and compiles data for reports to develop comprehensive studies for decision-making purposes and ensures information is provided within necessary time frames.
Organizes and analyzes data from all applicable sources, using statistical methods to ensure the validity of results.
Assists in the development of recommendations for changes to improve systems, applications, processes, or products.
Provides data and trend analysis during exploratory and informative stages.
Briefs RPO Program Analysts on problem areas, corrective action to be taken, and the monitoring of those actions once implemented.
Responds to all customer inquiries and concerns and recommends alternate approaches when customers' request cannot be met.
Qualifications:
Work Experience: A minimum of eight (8) recent years of relevant experience in conducting comprehensive program analyst services

Education: Program Analysts shall have, at a minimum, a relevant bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.

Additional Knowledge and Skills: In addition to the experience and educational requirements described above, Program Analysts shall clearly possess the following knowledge and skills:


Working knowledge of PC software packages, such as Microsoft Power BI, Power Automate, Excel, Access, SharePoint, various Microsoft programs, and other Business Intelligence software.
Experience with established program analysis principles, theories, and practices, including knowledge of various analytical techniques (audits, databases, spreadsheet/graphics analysis)
Working knowledge of qualitative and/or quantitative data analytic methods for the assessment and suggested improvements of program effectiveness.
Electronic Media:
All contractor employees shall be knowledgeable and proficient in the use of Microsoft Office basic tools and software: Word, Excel, Outlook, Share Points. It is mandatory that all contract employees be proficient with modern computing equipment.

English Language Requirement:
The Contractor shall ensure all personnel are able to read, write, and speak English well enough to effectively communicate.

U.S. Citizenship:
All contractor personnel performing under this contract shall be U.S. citizens.

Place of Performance:
This requirement requires contractor personnel to work off-site (remote). Travel to the nearest VA Medical Center is required for on-boarding (fingerprinting, PIV picture, PIV card and GFE). Contractor personnel are usually required to physically access the nearest VA facility when receiving GFE.

Jamison Corporate Overview:
Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (Jamison) is a Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) headquartered in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia. We specialize in providing professional management, administrative, healthcare, court reporters and transcriptionist experts, and document/ record and telehealth operational support solutions to U.S. Government, State and commercial clients. Jamison is a nationwide professional staff augmentation company, that helps commercial clients and government agencies expand their talent acquisition reach by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to be successful.

Jamison offers a wide range of employment opportunities in the commercial and government sectors. We seek employees who share our values of service excellence, integrity, and professionalism.

Jamison affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Our employees, as well as applicants and others with whom we do business, will not be subjected to sexual, racial, religious, ethnic, or any other form of unlawful harassment and/or discrimination. In addition, JPS adheres to the equal employment opportunity requirements of all states and localities in which it does business.

Jamison's commitment to equal opportunity is applied through every aspect of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, promotion, transfer, termination, and all other matters of employment.

Applicants may be required to successfully complete an online assessment to determine qualifications for positions requiring specific skills.

All applications must be submitted through our application system at: https://www.jps-online.com/apply-now/

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Experience in researching, planning, and recommending software and systems solutions

FEDITC, LLC is a fast-growing business supporting DoD and other intelligence agencies worldwide. FEDITC develops mission critical national security systems throughout the world directly supporting the Warfighter, DoD Leadership, & the country. We are proud & honored to provide these services.


Overview of position:


FEDITC is seeking a Systems Analyst III to work in the Warren, MI area. A United States Citizenship and an active Secret Security Clearance is required to be considered for this position.


Responsibilities:

Serve as the operations officer to the PM or PD offices.
Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions.
Provide services for various operations and activities of the PM or PD and Deputy Program Manager (DPM). Services include supporting the creation and management of various complex management projects, issues and initiatives.
Manage projects to assure priority actions are coordinated, staffed, and properly executed throughout PMs or PDs to guarantee timely, cohesive and accurate execution of work.
Respond to informational requests from PM or PD offices, Integrated Product Teams (IPTs), and external oversight organizations. The requests may consist of both scheduled requirements and ad hoc or short notice requirements, all of which must be drafted, properly coordinated, and completed in a timely fashion.
Staff Congressional inquiries, track responses, and report the outcome to the PM/PD leaders and/or COR. The contractor provides program information, analyses and recommendations to leadership for program actions and decisions.
Provide recommendations to PM offices on effective methods in resolving questions from the PM or PD to correct deficiencies in a timely manner, and in evaluating support to PM or PD management to assure the objectives are being met.
Review and respond to Requests for Information (RFI) and taskers command and coordinate/obtain concurrence from the PM/PD prior to release.
Review the PM or PDs daily correspondence with command, recommend courses of action, and provide taskers to the appropriate PM or PD office and other business groups to ensure the taskers are completed.
Research current DOD (to include DOD 5000.1 and 5000.2), Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), and local guidance to recommend policy and procedures in relation to current projects, taskings, issues and concerns.
Analyze information and data, assess progress of programs, projects, and processes.
Organize, manage, and present information to include oral recommendations.
Interface and coordinate with higher level staffs.
May collect and analyze data and develop decision support software, service, or products. May develop and supply optimal time, cost, or logistics networks for program evaluation, review, or implementation.
Other support duties as needed/directed.

Experience/Skills:

Seven (7) cumulative years of work experience (within the last 10-year period) in planning, coordinating, and monitoring projects within DoD.
Five (5) years supporting ACAT I program in an analytical role.
Five (5) years' experience in tracked/wheeled combat vehicle programs supporting program life-cycle management processes, using DoD 5000 weapon systems acquisition processes and program planning an ACAT 1 or 2 program for a Major Army Weapon System and Army staff procedures.
Five (5) years in a position that requires use of the FAR, DFARs, and DoD 5000 series acquisition policies and procedures.
Must have supported a program through at least one major Defense Acquisition Board (DAB) or equivalent process with experience interacting and coordinating with higher-level Department of Defense staff agencies (e.g. specific interaction with Assistant Secretary of the Army for Acquisition, Logistics and Technology (ASA (AL&T)) or other similar DoD staff agency).
5 years' experience utilizing Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), and Adobe Acrobat.


Experience/Education:

Master's degree in a specialized field* plus a minimum of 1 year of applicable experience; or, a
Bachelor's degree in the specialized field* plus 7 years of applicable experience; or, a
Bachelor's degree in any field with a minimum of 9 years of specialized experience.
Specialized Degree Field: Project Management, Business Management/Administration or other related field.
Specialized/applicable experience must be in the area of Project Management, Business Management/Administration or other related field.


Certifications:

DAU Level II Program Management certification
Program Management Professional (PMP) certification.


Clearance:

Active Secret Security Clearance is required.
Must be a US Citizen and pass a background check.
Maintain applicable security clearance(s) at the level required by the client and/or applicable certification(s) as requested by FEDITC and/or required by FEDITCS Client(s)/Customer(s)/Prime contractor(s).
