Job Title: Customer Service Representative/ EDI Analyst 3rd Shift
Job Description:
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

· Must be able to work weekends and some Holidays.

· Self-motivated - must be able to work with minimal supervision.

· Excellent communication, interpersonal skills and computer skills.

· Extensive knowledge working with electronic data preferred.

· Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) a must.

· Can communicate through email and phone conversations in a professional, fast pace environment.

· Knowledge in EDI function and architecture, including the interpretation of raw EDI data preferred.

· Must be capable of applying analytical tools to problem solving.

· Must have exceptional math, organizational and record keeping skills.

· Must have strong problem solving skills and be a self starter.

· Some understanding of the manufacturing process and manufacturing resources.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

· Daily scheduling of customer requirements.

· Translate customer data via EDI used to establish sequence and lead time for the production of parts to meet shipping dates according to sales forecasts and customer orders.

· Resolve shipping discrepancies and manage the dispute process with your customers using our Customer assigned portals.

· Assists traffic department in adjustments to the ship schedule.

· Convey to Process Managers any adjustments or changes in the schedule.

· Maintain open communication with customers regarding releases.

· Broadcast customer info to the appropriate members of the LexaMar Team.

EDUCATION REQUIRED:

· High School Diploma or equivalent

· Associates Degree in Administrative/Business preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Shift:

Night shift

Weekly day range:

Monday to Friday
Weekends as needed

Work setting:

In-person

Work Location: In person

SUMMARY

The Oracle Senior Business Analyst is part of the Information Technology team. This key position will be relied upon as the principal subject matter expert for the Oracle Cloud CRM and sales / eCommerce modules and integration with Salesforce and Eloqua systems. The senior business analyst works closely with business users to understand, analyze and document business processes and requirements and work with technical architects to formulate systems that parallel overall business strategies. He or she will serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and the IT teams to define business and system processes through workflows and written requirements to support implementation of Oracle Fusion Cloud. This position is responsible for solving complex business problems using analytical, technical, and business skills. This position manages complex projects and applications and relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Serves in a consultative capacity to define and prioritize requirements, translate requirements into system functions, understand application configurations and customizations which deliver on requirements into finished production systems
Serves as an advisor and expert to business stakeholders with functional knowledge of Oracle Sales Cloud (including sales functions, sales organizations, lead management, opportunity management, quote management, territory management, reporting, etc.)
Responsible for analyzing business processes and driving requirements gathering in order to improve efficiencies and deliver on the defined transformation vision of the Oracle Fusion Cloud implementation:
Augment previous experience by developing thorough understanding of internal processes and industry best practices for functions within Champion Homes
Proactively identify and prioritize high impact improvements through the analysis of current and future state processes
Create documentation to translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, business system interfaces, data flows and reports
Define initiatives and design methods / alternatives that most closely align with the specific timetables, objectives and business issues at hand. These alternatives may include the critical review and enhancement of business processes (in conjunction with business partners) as well as technology.
Facilitate the development of and understand the business case (cost / benefit analysis) behind all projects, including the motivating factors for all stakeholders
Create the appropriate relationships with the project team to ensure that specifications are understood and to monitor the build progress to ensure compliance and the delivery of a quality product.
Manage the expectations of the project sponsor, the stakeholders, the project team and executive management
Keep apprised of new and emerging business process management, planning and requirement gathering techniques and work with the IT Management to enhance, improve and refine Champion Homes' approach
Support successful implementation by adhering to sound methodologies for project management, business analysis and design, quality assurance, and customer support:
Develop clear and concise project plans, timely status reports and other project-related documentation
Provide day-to-day management of all project deliverables
Oversee tracking and disposition of project-related business and technical issues; provide issue resolution and escalation
Develop and manage project budget(s) and project change control process
Advise project sponsor, stakeholders, project team and executive management and act as mentor to business team leaders
Leads analysis for data conversion of existing legacy data into new systems by analyzing data extracts and complete data mapping
Coordinate internal and external development teams for estimation, planning and delivery of the project
Act as ongoing liaison with contractors and consulting organizations
Manage the execution of testing for assigned deliverables by identifying and documenting test defects, documenting quality issues, and communicating defects to assure resolution
Oversee creation, approval and execution of business procedures and training programs
Ensure adequate end user support staffing for initial rollout and transition
Function as subject matter expert (SME) and represent clients/users throughout lifecycle of a project:
Monitor supported application(s) for data quality, efficiency, operation, and data integrity.
Manage and maintain security for supported application(s)
Promote systems integration to leverage technology and reduce data redundancy
Provide second tier user support for deployed systems including issue tracking and resolution.
Support go-live readiness, production cutover, and post-go-live warranty support
Maintain a familiarity with new and currently installed applications in order to provide customer support and direction on the effective use and continued growth of the application products
Function as the IT liaison and advocate for designated business departments and coordinate regular information gathering sessions with the users for the purpose of reviewing, analyzing and evaluating their needs and the overall performance of IT as a department
Plan, create, coordinate, and deliver end-user training as needed
Work with the Testing, Change, and Release Manager to facilitate and execute activities related to quarterly updates, including researching known issues, testing key processes, and educating business stakeholders on new functionality


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Education, Training and/or Experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 8 to 10 years' experience implementing Oracle Fusion Cloud, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

5+ years of experience with technical implementations of CRM and/or eCommerce projects
Must have completed at least one full project lifecycle of Sales / CRM implementation, ideally Oracle Sales Cloud
PMP certification a plus, but not required


Technical Knowledge and Skills

Experience in Oracle Cloud Fusion implementation and integration with related systems
Experience with automated and manual data conversions, including planning, execution and validation from legacy systems to Oracle Fusion Cloud
Demonstrated project management experience and ability to deliver large scale complex global initiatives.
Demonstrated experience in hands-on project management
Implementation of several IT development or customized package solutions in direct interaction with user departments
Experience planning, leading and participating in all forms of testing, training and support for mid to large size software implementations
Planning both analysis and implementation projects, including estimating and controlling tasks, resources, budgets, and schedules
Knowledge / demonstrated experience with Oracle Sales Cloud; CPQ integration with Oracle Sales Cloud a plus
Knowledge / demonstrated experience with Oracle CX solutions a plus: Oracle CX Sales/Service and/or CX Marketing (Eloqua) a plus.
Experience working with Sales and Sales Operations organizations and personnel
Personal Characteristics
Interest in constantly keeping current of latest trends, best practices and competitive activity
Able to apply common sense understanding to carry out complex instruction furnished in written, oral, or diagram form
Ability to handle multiple priorities in a results-oriented environment and continue to deliver quality service.
Excellent written and oral communication skills: ability to communicate with all levels, ability to speak clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations, write clearly and informatively in various formats
Sensitivity and ability to communicate / negotiate user wants vs. needs
Assertive leadership and ability to influence people in driving vision and change
Highly effective communication and listening skills to understand complex processes and relate technical information in a way understandable and actionable with non-technical users
Ability to design workflows and procedures
Willingness and ability to make timely decisions, exhibiting sound and accurate judgment. Ability to support and explain reasoning for decisions and include appropriate people in the decision-making process.
Ability to independently solve or suggest solutions for business-related problems within strategic and operational timeframes
Ability to synthesize complex or diverse information.
Ability to use intuition and experience to complement research and findings.
Ability to identify and define problems, collect and research data skillfully, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to present recommendations with clarity in written and graphic form.


Applicable Technical Skills

Oracle Sales Cloud
eCommerce
Salesforce a plus
Eloqua
ERP integration with customer and dealer portals
Master Data Management


WORK LOCATION AND TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Weekend and evening support may be required at times (i.e. Implementations-related scheduled work and unplanned outages)
Willingness to travel to regional business offices, manufacturing facilities, and other locations as required - Up to 25% travel
Remote work is acceptable with periodic travel to core locations for engagement and interaction with key stakeholders and leadership


This position description is not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties or skills required for the job and is subject to review and change at any time, with or without notice, in accordance with the needs of Champion Homes. Since no position description can detail all the duties and responsibilities that may be required from time to time in the performance of a job, duties and responsibilities that may be inherent in a job, reasonably required for its performance, or required due to the changing nature of the job shall also be considered part of the jobholder's responsibility.

Company Name: The Center for Therapeutic Learning and Communication, PLLC
Job Description:
We’re now hiring for a full-time Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

The Center for TLC is a family-centered pediatric therapy facility that serves infants through young adults and provides one-on-one services to meet each individual's needs. We are looking for a professional, caring, and fun individual that has a strong desire to assist each child in meeting their maximum potential in a fun and loving atmosphere.

As a BCBA, your primary duties will be performed in TLC's pediatric clinic and are as followed:

Gather patient information through conducting interviews and assessments to learn about the patient’s target behaviors. Propose a strategy for behavior change.
Collaborate with the patient’s therapy team to continue progress to meet their goals
Perform treatment duties as appropriate
Communicates effectively with patients and their parents, co-workers, physicians, and other TLC team members as needed regarding patient care needs and adequately documents all aspects of patient care
Supervises and/or delegates to assistant therapist as appropriate
Effectively implement/teach treatment plan to line therapist, family, and TLC team.
Collect and analyze data
Evaluate the treatment plan/goals and update or change as necessary for patient success.
Completes all necessary and accurate patient billing information.

Experience is preferred, but new grads encouraged to apply

Hours revolve around caseload
Ability to sit, stand, walk, bend, kneel, twist, crawl, grasp, reach, and lift up to 50lbs.

Total Spectrum is hiring a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to join them in providing high-quality, evidence-based, contemporary ABA therapy to children with autism. Synthesis ABA is looking for an experienced, motivated Behavioral Analyst to conduct behavior assessments and develop behavior plans, and to provide behavior analytic services for clients in Kalamazoo, Calhoun, and Van Buren Counties.

We offer individualized employment opportunities with the ability to enjoy flexible scheduling.

We strongly value work-life balance! Everything is software-based, flexible hours, with the ability to make your own schedule. Our goal is, that you should love what you do!

Mission Statement:

Synthesis ABA, LLC. strives to provide high quality applied behavior analysis services that focus on improving health, independence, and quality of life for each individual client. Our goal is to make a fun, positive, and learning environment for anyone that interacts with Synthesis ABA.

About Us:

Synthesis ABA, LLC. provides both center and in-home natural environment, evidence-based support in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis to individuals and their families who have been clinically diagnosed on the autism spectrum. Age ranges from 2 years and older.

Our experienced team has helped many children, young adults, and families, learn, grow, and bring out each individual's strengths to reach their maximum potential. We develop programs to fit each child’s specific needs and take great pride in seeing each of our clients and families succeed.

As a member of the Synthesis ABA team, you will have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment and engage in a wide range of activities, focused on providing ABA based assessment and treatment services in our clinical center, at client homes, and/or in community settings.

Synthesis ABA Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) Job Description:

Oversee client treatment from assessment through care delivery
Conduct initial and follow-up functional, behavioral and developmental assessments
Use evaluation tools such as VB-MAPP, the Assessment Functional Living Skills (AFLS), and Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scales-III
Develop, oversee and implement client’s IEPs and Treatment Plans
Design positive behavioral treatment and skill acquisition plans with goals tailored to the individual
Serve as the clinical lead on client cases, providing supervision and training to Behavior Technicians.
Implement, model and monitor progress of individualized behavior support and skill plans with ABA technicians
Monitor and review client programs to analyze data, measure progress, and make necessary changes to the treatment plan
Observe program implementation, and provide training on interventions as needed
Provide training and support to parents, caregivers, and ABA technicians who implement plans with children and families on principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
Meet with primary caregivers to discuss observations and concerns
Collaborate with colleagues, parents, and schools to share information and implement best practice intervention programs across settings
Promote awareness and disseminate information regarding ASD and Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) through training and presentations, both on- and off-site
Attend and participate in team meetings where ideas, success stories, and recent research topics are presented for discussion and use in treatment

Job Requirements:

Required to have a Master’s degree in applied behavior analysis (ABA), or psychology or special education with ABA Certification
Required to be board certified (BCBA) with two + years’ experience with individuals diagnosed on the autism spectrum
One to two years of supervisory experience is preferred
Conduct functional behavior assessments
Write behavioral positive behavior support plans
Vehicle required with travel between assignments, and valid driver's license.
Experience working with children, teens, and young adults with autism

Join our team at Autism Systems. We’re looking for a BCBA, BCaBA or QBHP to join our team in Macomb County, MI!

With multiple clinical centers and staff across Michigan we provide an unparalleled opportunity for BCBA’s to make an impact with clients and to learn and grow through collaboration with our professional staff. While we have locations in multiple locations. Our centers are all small units that work closely together to meet our common mission: child development through the only evidence-based practice known to help individuals with autism achieve long term goals and live their most meaningful and functionally independent lives.

ABOUT AUTISM SYSTEMS

Autism Systems is an Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) treatment provider committed to providing the best quality care for our clients. We take aim to continually establish best-in-class standards in integrity and quality for not only ourselves and clients, but also in the field of ABA. We collaborate with client families, focusing on the individuality of each child, to generate longevity in client outcomes. We strive to hire and to invest in our greatest asset - our employees, who are the heart of Autism Systems.

You’ll have the opportunity to work in a team-oriented environment and engage in a wide range of activities, focused on providing behavior analytic assessment and treatment services in our clinical centers, at client homes, and/or in community settings.

· Collaborate with colleagues, parents, and schools to share information and implement best practice intervention programs across settings

· Attend and participate in team meetings where ideas, success stories, and recent research topics are presented for discussion and use in treatment

Possess a bachelors/master’s degree in ABA or a related field

Meet the physical requirements of the position, to include bending, running, standing, sitting, or lifting up to 50lbs.
Enjoy working in a multitiered-collaborative team approach to develop and implement client treatment plans
Have strong organizational skills, are detail-oriented, able to maintain records, prepare reports and reliably develop timely correspondence related to work

Have the flexibility to work independently when needed, but also enjoy working as a part of the larger team

Job Title: Tax Specialist- Transfer Pricing

Department / Division: Tax/Finance

Salary Range: For Michigan and locations not listed above: $78,107-$101,080 plus an annual bonus

For California and Washington D.C.: $84,338-$109,143 plus an annual bonus

For New York: $89,033-$115,219 plus an annual bonus

Location: Ada, MI or remote from CA, WA, CO, IL, TX, FL, GA, NC, NJ, NY, MI or Washington D.C.


What We’re Looking For:

We are seeking a highly motivated Transfer Pricing Analyst to join our dynamic Tax team. Reporting to the Global Transfer Pricing Manager, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring compliance with international transfer pricing regulations and optimizing our intercompany pricing structures. You will be responsible for coordinating with GBS to gather and analyze data, conduct functional, risk, and economic analyses, and contribute to transfer pricing documentation preparation. Your role will involve collaborating with external advisors, GBS, and corporate teams to support transfer pricing foreign audits and address specific questions related to global price setting. You'll have the opportunity to build strong relationships with functional and competency leads within GBS, perform area-specific research, and provide support to various global tax competency groups as needed.


In this role, you will regularly accomplish a range of duties, including preparing specific transfer pricing documentations, assisting with tax aspects of financial matters such as repatriation of funds and loans, managing transfer price calculations, and staying updated on the latest developments in tax regulations. Additionally, you'll support the scoping, design, testing, and ongoing improvement of processes, procedures, and technology solutions, enhancing efficiency in your role. Collaboration will be a key aspect of your work, as you interface with personnel from all areas of the organization to obtain financial and other relevant data. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to our organization's financial compliance and global tax strategy while developing your expertise in international taxation and transfer pricing.


Required qualifications:

Minimum 3 - 5 years’ related experience in Tax or Finance with a bachelor’s degree in Tax, Accounting, or similar field
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Knowledge & experience in all aspects of transfer pricing research and compliance would be helpful
Talent to collaborate with internal partners and external advisors to bring projects forward to completion


Skills to be successful in the role:

Knowledge of JDE, Oracle would be helpful
Public Accounting experience in a multinational setting
Tax Knowledge - Demonstrated knowledge & experience with tax analysis for country/region of responsibility
Research & Analysis - Demonstrated ability to research, analyze and draw conclusions from tax-related laws, regulations and court cases.
Analyze Data - Ability to read, interpret and draw accurate conclusions from financial and numerical material.
Communicate Financial Information - Effectively communicating and presenting complex financial data (both verbally and written) to influence all levels and global audiences, helps others understand financial data and translate it into actionable business insights.
Strategic Thinking - Ability to think strategically and understand the broader view. Demonstrates an understanding of the long-term, "big picture" view of needs and opportunities.
Project Manager - Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.
Critical Thinking - Ability to formulate conclusions and recommendations using facts and data, financial and business analysis, deductive reasoning and sound judgment.
Consulting - Ability to effectively provide technical or business guidance to clients, both internal and external; knowledge of applicable tools and techniques to maximize consulting effectiveness.
Relationship Management - Ability to develop and maintain effective and productive relationships, including ability to influence, negotiate and manage conflicts effectively and constructively with clients, vendors and peers.
Knowledge of the Business - Knowledge of the business and the key internal and external drivers that affect the business, including financial, political and industry trends.


What’s special about this team:

The Transfer Pricing team is a dedicated and close-knit group of professionals who play a crucial role in shaping the global financial landscape of our organization. With a collaborative spirit, this team of experts, consisting of approximately 8 members, takes on the intricate and ever-evolving challenges of transfer pricing in a multinational setting. What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to precision and compliance while also being forward-thinking in our approach. We foster strong partnerships not only within our team but also with key stakeholders across various departments, including finance, tax, legal, and business development, as well as different foreign affiliates. As part of this dynamic group, you'll be exposed to a wide array of complex transfer pricing projects, offering you an intellectually stimulating environment that not only challenges your expertise but also provides a platform for professional growth and innovation.


This role is “Not” eligible for sponsorship.

Why You

Blue Lakes is looking to hire empathetic, professional, and reliable clinicians to support our learners.

Individuals who are passionate about ABA therapy, providing quality care while keeping in mind our clients and families we serve.

Why Us

You will get continued training, and support from our Chief Clinical Excellence , ethics, and operations teams such as an open-door policy for all staff to voice their concerns; including a dedicated Support Center to assist you and your staff with the resolution of administrative issues and tasks. Duties:
- Conduct assessments and develop individualized treatment plans for clients with developmental disabilities, particularly autism
- Implement evidence-based behavioral interventions and strategies to address behavioral challenges and promote skill development
- Provide direct one-on-one behavioral therapy to children with special needs
- Collect and analyze data to monitor progress and make data-driven decisions regarding treatment plans
- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team including parents, teachers, and other professionals to ensure coordinated care and consistent implementation of interventions
- Provide training and support to parents, caregivers, and other team members on behavior management techniques and strategies
- Stay up-to-date on the latest research and best practices in the field of applied behavior analysis (ABA) and special education

Skills:
- Board Certification as a Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
- Experience working with children with developmental disabilities, particularly autism
- Strong knowledge of applied behavior analysis principles and techniques
- Ability to conduct functional behavior assessments and develop behavior intervention plans
- Proficient in data collection and analysis to inform treatment decisions
- Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with clients, families, and team members
- Strong organizational skills to manage caseloads, documentation, and scheduling

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
